loans.name: Ademar Dinarte

texts.es:
Ademar tiene 40 años,  es un señor que se  dedica al oficio de la ebanistería, vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Don Ademar  se ocupa de realizar trabajos de ebanistería y  dice que este proyecto es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han beneficiado de sus  productos, además tiene  algunas metas que desea lograr con ayuda financiera.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Ademar es un micro crédito de  un millón de colones (1.000.000) para compra de materia prima (madera) y para remodelar su taller.  
Ademar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Ademar is 40 and makes a living through carpentry.  He lives with his wife and kids in a community called Osa, which is located in Caña Blancal in Puntarenas.  This community is known for being a very rural area and is visited a lot because of its beaches.  Its main economic industries are tourism and agriculture.

Ademar does carpentry work, and he says it is very interesting to him because he has seen how his business is growing little by little.  His demand is always getting stronger, and the neighbors in the community have benefitted from his products.  He also has some goals that he hopes to reach with financial help.

Ademar is requesting a loan for one million colones to buy supplies (wood) and to remodel his shop.

Ademar is a member of the communal bank of Caña Blancal, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costar Rica.  With this loan, he hopes to grow at a personal and economic level.  He also points out that thanks to this type of organization and ways of facilitating credit, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to remodel his carpentry shop and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Município da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 1 filha que frequenta a Escola. Formou se como professora e parou por falta de tempo, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta os seus pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas. 
	
Saiu de Manhica para Boane quando foi transferida pelos serviços. É professora há mais de 10 anos e tem um salário de 7.619.00.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Já teve empréstimo no BIM no valor de 30.000.00mt aplicado na compra de bens de consumo e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (chapas de zinco, portas, ferro, janelas, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.500.00mt, 9.200.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 25.000.00mt, aplicados na habitação. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the municipality of Manhiça, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has a daughter who attends school. She graduated as a teacher and stopped due to lack of time. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her parents by sending money to help with their expenses.
She left Manhica for Boane when she got transferred because of work. She has been a teacher for over 10 years and earns a salary of 7.619mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan with BIM for 30.000mt, which she used to purchase consumer goods, and she managed to repay it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to build her house (zinc sheets, doors, iron, windows, etc). The previous loans were for 6.500mt, 9.200mt, 10.000mt and 25.000mt, for housing expenses.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to finish building her home, and for that purpose she plans to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build her home (zinc sheets, doors, iron, windows, etc.).

loans.name: Blanca Herlinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica y natural, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Blanca tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijo quienes son todos mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora Blanca se dedica a la agricultura, siembra plantas ornamentales y las vende en un mercado de la ciudad. También se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla actividad que aprendió de su madre. Cría animales como cuyes, cerdos y gallinas.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banca comunal y lo va a invertir comprando cerdos y abono para sus cultivos.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “Emprendedores Del Futuro” (Entrepreneurs of the Future).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city noted for its architectural and natural beauty.  Since December, 1999, it’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  It’s bathed by four rivers, its cuisine is varied and it captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Blanca is 62 years old, married and has five children who are all adults; four of them are married and live independently and her single son works and helps her economically.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and she owns the house she lives in.

Blanca is a farmer.  She grows ornamental plants that she sells in a market in the city.  She also weaves straw hats, an activity she learned from her mother.  She also raises animals like guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.

She’s in the second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy pigs and manure for her crops.  Her goal is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and manure.

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys es socia del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica y natural, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Gladys tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Gladys se encuentra muy bien de salud y toda su familia también. Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos, actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años, inicio con este negocio para implementar en el negocio de su esposo quien tiene un taller de reparación de vehículos.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando mercadería para su negocio y no tuvo dificultad en los pagos. Como su negocio va muy bien solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar  más repuestos automotrices.
 
Su meta es de agrandar mas el negocio implementando una variedad más grande de repuestos de vehículo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Emprendedores Del Futuro” (Entrepreneurs of the Future).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city noted for its architectural and natural beauty.  Since December, 1999 it’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  It’s bathed by four rivers, its cuisine is varied and it captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Gladys is 33 years old, married and has two children who are 7 and 6 years old who attend the little local elementary school.  Her husband is an auto mechanic and works in his own shop.  The house they live in is their property.

Gladys is in good health and so is her family.  She sells auto parts, an activity she’s been carrying out for the last two years.  She started the business to increase business for her husband who has a car repair shop.

She used her previous loan to buy merchandise for her business and had no difficulty making her payments.  Since her business is doing very well she’s asking for a new loan to buy more auto parts.  Her goal is to enlarge the business more stocking a wider variety of auto parts.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Jhannina Jhaqueline Avila Moncayo

texts.es:
La Señora Jhanina es socia del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica y natural, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Jhannina tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 14 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Jhanina se encuentra delicada en su salud debido que hace un tiempo sufre de constantes dolores de estomago y también tiene desgastado el hueso del fémur pero aun no se ha realizado algún tratamiento, su familia se encuentra muy bien en la salud. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas hace 4 años, ha elegido esta actividad porque no tiene jefes y le permite cuidar de su casa y aportar a la economía de su hogar.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en cosméticos, vendió muy bien y no tuvo ningún problema en los pagos. Como ella es una mujer emprendedora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en un nuevo negocio, va a comprar arroz y azúcar para la venta. La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo y la facilidad para obtener los créditos.

Su meta es comprarse un terreno y sacarles adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhanina is a member of the “Emprendedores Del Futuro” (Entrepreneurs of the Future).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city noted for its architectural and natural beauty.  Since December, 1999 it’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  It’s bathed by four rivers, its cuisine is varied and it captivates the palates of locals and foreigners alike.  Its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Jhanina is 40 years old, married and has three children who are 19, 15 and 14 years old who attend a local secondary school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  The house she lives in his her property.

Jhanina is in precarious health because she’s been suffering with constant stomach pains for a time now and she also has a weakened femur but she’s not undergone any treatment yet.  Her family is in very good health.  She has been selling four different brands of cosmetics for the last four years.  She chose this activity because she has no bosses and she can take care of her house while contributing to the home’s economy.

She used her previous loan to buy cosmetics.  Her sales were good and she had no problem with her payments.  Since she’s an enterprising woman, she’s going to use her new loan to invest in a new business.  She is going to buy rice and sugar to sell. 

She likes the communal bank because of the team spirit and the ease of obtaining loans.  Her goal is to buy a piece of land and to move her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 56-year-old married woman. She has 10 children.  Mwanakombo operates a retail business. She's worked in this business for over 20 years. Her primary customers are villagers. Mwanakombo's other source of income includes husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanakombo will use the Kes 40000 loan to purchase sacks of beans, sugar and washing detergents to sell. Mwanakombo aspires to open a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of its good public relations.

loans.use: buy beans, sugar and washing detergents

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola e os outros já formaram suas famílias. Fez a 2ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte de seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta o seu neto que vive com ela. 
	

É negociante há mais de 20 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BCI).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu décimo quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 22.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (arroz, farinha, feijão, refrescos, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.900.00mt, 4.500.00mt, 5.100.00mt, 7.310.00mt, 8.072.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 10.393.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 12.248.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 16.616.00mt, 22.000.00mt, e 25.022.00mt, aplicados no comércio. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's single and has six children - three of them attend school, the others have already started their own families. She completed 2nd grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports her grandson who lives with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over 20 years. She sells various products and earns an income of about 5.000mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans with other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her 14th loan with Hluvuku. It is for 22.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise (rice, flour, beans, refreshments, etc.). The previous loans were for 3.900mt, 4.500mt, 5.100mt, 7.310mt, 8.072mt, 10.000mt, 10.393mt, 12.000mt, 12.248mt, 15.000mt, 16.616mt, 22.000mt and 25.022mt, for her business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (rice, flour, beans, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Yamileth Vargas

texts.es:
Yamileth Necesita  tener mayores recursos  para sacar adelante a su familia y considera que el  negocio de la costura es una fuente prometedora  para lograrlo y está dispuesta a hacer su mayor esfuerzo   en este propósito.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Yamileth es un micro crédito de un millón  de colones (1.000.000), para comprar una máquina de coser y telas para confeccionar prendas y venderlas en la comunidad y fuera de ella.

Doña Yamileth es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones  socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Yamileth needs to improve her economic resources in order to raise her family, and believes that her sewing business is a promising source to achieve this goal. She is willing to do her utmost to succeed.

Yamileth is currently requesting a loan for one million colones (1,000,000) to purchase a sewing machine and fabric to make garments which she will sell in her neighborhood and beyond.

Yamileth is a member of the Caña Blancal Communal Credit Company, one of the 110 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. With this loan, she hopes to be able to grow personally and financially. She also says that it is thanks to these organizations and credit facilitators that she is able to devote more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to make clothing to sell

loans.name: Guarapi Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Guarapi, debido a que asi se llama  su barrio donde ellas vivenn, el grupo esta en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundacion paraguaya. Ellas son personas muy trabajadras y desean ayudar a sus familias por medio su trabajo.
Blanca es la presidenta del grupo, y nos comenta que se dedica a la decoracion, ella decora todo tipo de eventos, como ser cumpleaños, fiestas y demás, y comenta que le va muy bien, por que tiene ya muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en su trabajo, quiere comprar telas, cinta ancha, globos, etc, pues estos son los insumos que más usa para su trabajo.
texts.en:
This communal bank goes by the name of "Guarapi", as this the name of the neighborhood where the members live.  The group is in their second lending cycle as part of the Entrepreneurial Women program of Fundacion Paraguaya. They are very hard-working women, and they want to support their families by means of their work.

Blanca is the president of the group, and she tells us that she works doing event decorations.  She provides decorations for all kinds of events, such as birthdays, parties and more, and she comments that things are going very well for her as she has a very good customer base.

She is requesting the loan to be able to invest it in her work.  She wants to buy fabric, wide ribbons, balloons, etc., as these are the supplies that she uses most in her work.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, wide ribbons, balloons, etc.

loans.name: Oldemar Dinarte

texts.es:
Oldemar es un señor de 41 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene entre sus proyectos reparar la casa en la que vive con su familia, ya que está bastante deteriorada, considera  que a través de este préstamo puede lograrlo y darle a su familia la posibilidad de una vivienda digna.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Oldemar es un micro crédito de quinientos mil colones para comprar materiales de construcción  como madera, cemento y cerámica entre otros .

Oldemar  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Oldemar is a 41 year old man who lives with his family in a community called Osa located in Caña Blanca which is in Puntarenas.  This community stands out because it’s a rural zone that gets many visitors because of its beaches.  The main economic activities are tourism, farming and raising livestock.

Among his projects is to repair the house he lives in with his family because it’s quite deteriorated.  He feels that through this loan he will be able to accomplish this and give his family the possibility of having a proper home.

What Oldemar is asking for at this time is a five-hundred thousand colones loan to buy building materials like lumber, cement and tile, among others.

Oldemar is a member of the Caña Blanca communal bank, one of Edesa’s 150 member organization in Costa Rica.  With this loan he hopes to grow more both personally and economically.  He also points out that thanks to this type of organization and credit facilitating means, he can spend more time on productive activities.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house repair.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue una de las miembros quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la fundacion paraguaya.
La sra.Sonia tiene una despensa, esta casada con el señor Antonio, tienen  3 hijos, menores de edad que vive con ella. Ella nos dice que gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que día a dñia puedan salir adelnate y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, bebidas, golosinas, yerba, etc. Ella tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee was initiated by one of the members, who organized and invited her friends to join the program called 'Committee of Entrepreneurial Women' (Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras) of the Fundacion Paraguaya.

Sonia has a small food store. She is married to Antonio and they have 3 young children who live with them. She tells us that thanks to her work and effort she has been able to give her family everything they need to succeed in day-to-day life, and have a better lifestyle.

Sonia is applying for a loan credit for the purchase of baked goods, beverages, candy, tea, etc. She aims to expand her business to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food store.

loans.name: Virgen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está integrado por 12 mujeres, quienes son personas muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias y salir adelante.
Pascuala es una de las miembros del grupo, se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, y debido a eso ha podido crecer y llegar a lo que hoy es. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder convertirse en una gran microempresaria exitosa, que sea capaz de ayudar a sus familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Virgen' communal bank is located in the city of San Lorenzo, and is composed of 12 women who are hard working and eager to succeed, thereby helping their families cope and get ahead.

Pascuala is one of the group members. She has a business selling all kinds of garments which is doing very well, and due to its success she has been able to grow the business into what it is today. Her goal is to continue working and become a successful entrepreneur who is able to help her family.

Pascuala is requesting a loan to purchase clothing, which will increase her stock and enable her to offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing garments for subsequent sale

loans.name: Yrupe Group

texts.es:
El comité de la ciudad de Paraguarí lleva por nombre Yrupe, debido a que asi se llama la calle de su Barrio, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto y responsabilidad  mutua, actualmente se encuentran en el Quinto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  12 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Apolinaria s define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con mucho espíritu de progreso. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace ya un tiempo, por o que ya tiene una clientela bien definida. Cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene que llevar la leche a la mesa de sus clientes para el desayuno.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma poder tener mayor cantidad en stock, y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank from the city of Paraguarí are called 'Yrupe', because that is the name of their neighborhood street. They are committed to keeping the group together and they work under a framework of respect and mutual responsibility. The bank is currently in their fifth cycle with excellent ratings. The group is composed of 12 women who invest their loans in their respective activities.

Apolinaria defines herself as a hard working and enterprising woman, with a lot of spirit to progress. She says that she has been selling milk for quite some time and so already has a well-defined clientele. She starts work very early in the morning every day, as she has to deliver milk to the customer's table in time for breakfast.

Apolinaria is requesting a loan to purchase milk, which will increase her stock and enable her to have more supplies so that she can fulfill the orders from her customers.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El presente comite se formo por medio de que algunas integrantes ya estaban en el progama de comite de mujeres, las mismas invitaron a sus vecinas para formar parte del programa, y es asi como surge el  Comité Oñondivepa.
La sra. Alberta es Empleada Domestica y tambien vendedora de todo tipo de comestibles, trabajos gracias a los cuales ha podido salir adelnate y ayudar a su familia. Ella  esta casada con el Sr Damian, con quien tiene 4 hijos. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia y a su mmarido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para hacer los alimentos que vende, como ser harina, huevo, leche, carne y demás. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva por la oportunidad que estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed by some members who were already involved in the 'Committee for Entrepreneurial Women' program. They invited their neighbors to join the program, and that is how the communal bank 'Oñondivepa' was formed.

Alberta is a domestic employee, and also has a business selling all kinds of food. Thanks to these jobs she has been able to succeed and help her family. She is married to Damian and they have 4 children. Her goal is to continue working and thus be able to continue helping her family and her husband.

Alberta is requesting this loan to buy the supplies needed to make the food she sells, such as flour, eggs, milk and meat among others. She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, milk and meat, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 26 años de edad es soltero , no cuenta con dependientes pero vive en casa de una tía , nació en la ciudad de La Paz desde muy temprana edad trabaja en diversas actividades pero gracias a este esfuerzo pudo estudiar en la Universidad Técnica la carrera de Electrónica y así poder tener mejores oportunidades laborales, así logro llegar a técnico medio ya egresado Luis dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo  al servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de equipos electrónicos, es técnico medio en electrónica tiene un local comercial alquilado en una zona bastante comercial en la ciudad de La Paz.
Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su negocio para así poder obtener más utilidades y poder ahorrar un poco de dinero en estos meses  para poder algún día poder tener su local propio y varios empleados que realicen este tipo de trabajos.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old. He is single and has no dependents, but he lives in the house of an aunt. He was born in the city of La Paz. He has worked at various jobs from a very young age, but thanks to this effort he was able to study electronics at the technical university and thus be able to have better job opportunities. Thus he succeeded in becoming a graduate middle-level technician. Luis spends the majority of his time doing repairs and maintenance of electronic equipment. He is a middle-level technician in electronics. He has a rented commercial space in a fairly commercial zone in the city of La Paz.

Luis is applying for the loan to purchase spare parts for his business so that he will be able to obtain better earnings and be able to save a little money in these months, so that one day he will be able to have his own shop and a number of employees who do this type of work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité La Esperanza es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité son personas muy trabajadoras y tienen muchas ansias de progresar y salir adelante. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de sus familias y ayudarles a tener un estilo de vida mejor.
La Sra. Juliana es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Comenta que tiene buena venta ya que gracias a la buena calidad de sus prendas ya tiene una clientela bien definida, que siempre compra de ella. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y también a la vez atraer a más.
texts.en:
This communal bank, La Esperanze (The Hope), is from the city of San Lorenzo. The members of the bank are very hard-working people and have great eagerness to progress and succeed. Their goal is to improve the conditions of their families and help them to have a better way of life.

Señora Juliana is one of the members. She sells clothing of all types. She comments that she has good sales, since thanks to the good quality of her clothing, she already has a well-defined clientele who always buy from her. Her goal is to continue working and in this way help her family. She is applying for the loan to purchase clothing, with which she will be able to offer greater variety to her customers and at the same time attract more.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael es un joven de 25 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas.  Esta comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Este joven de nombre Michael,  tiene un gran espíritu de superación  y muchos deseos de ver crecer su negocio de mueblería, con este trabajo de confección de muebles ha beneficiado a muchas personas de la comunidad .

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Michael es un micro crédito de un millón de colones (1.000.000), para comprar madera y  otros  materiales   para seguir desarrollando su trabajo  con mayor productividad.

Michael es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Michael, 25, is a young man living with his family in a community called Osa located in Caña Blanca in Puntarenas Province.  This community stands out because it’s a rural zone that gets many visitors due to its beaches.  Its main economic activities are tourism, farming and raising livestock.

This young man whose name is Michael has a great spirit of improvement and many desires to see his furniture business grow. He has benefitted many people in his community with this furniture making work.

What Michael needs at this moment is a one million colones micro loan to buy lumber and other materials to continue developing his work with more productivity.

Michael is a member of the Caña Blanca communal bank, one of Edesa’s 110 member organizations in Costa Rica.  With this loan he hopes to grow more both personally and economically.  He also points out that thanks to this type of organization and credit facilitating means he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make wood furniture.

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres en Acción se conformo gracias a que la asesora realizo una promoción a vecinas y amigas de las ciudad de Itá. El grupo está integrado por  14 señoras quienes siguen trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo de cuando empezaron, ya se encuentran en el 5° ciclo, en forma conjunta y trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa.
Una de las miembros de este grupo es la señora Mari, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de cosméticos, y de todas las marcas. Se inicio con unas cuantas clientas, y luego gracias a su buen papel de vendedora fue creciendo y mejorando cada día más.
Ella quiere seguir trabajando y es por ello que solicita el crédito, pues desea comprar más cosméticos y de esa forma estar siempre bien surtida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Women in Action (Mujeres en Acción) communal bank was formed when the advisor promoted the program to neighbors and friends in the town of Itá. The group consists of 14 ladies who still work with the same enthusiasm as when they first began. They are already in their 5th cycle. They work together and are very comfortable participating in the program. 

One of the members of this group is Mari who sells all kinds of cosmetics of all brands. She started with a few clients, and thanks to her good skills as a saleswoman, her business has been growing and improving every day.

Mari wants to keep working and is therefore requesting this loan because she wants to buy more cosmetics so that she can always be well stocked for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rasse

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Município da Catembe, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola e os outros já formaram suas famílias. Nunca teve oportunidade de frequentar a Escola por falta de condições financeiras pela parte de seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela. 
	

É negociante há mais de 27 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de6.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (amendoim, farinha, feijão, refrescos, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt,15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, aplicados no comércio. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negócio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the municipality of Catembe, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She's married and has  six children. - only one of them still attends school, the others have already started their own families. She never had the opportunity to go to school because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She has been a businesswoman for over 27 years. She sells various products and earns an income of about 6.500mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise (peanuts, flour, beans, refreshments, etc.). The previous loans were for 10.000mt, 15.000mt and 20.000mt, for her retail business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business, and for that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, flour, beans, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Victor Chinchilla

texts.es:
Don Víctor es un señor de 64 años de edad ,  vive en la comunidad  llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Don Víctor se dedica a la cría de tilapias, producto consumible en la zona donde vive  y otras partes del país. Con  el proyecto de tilapias pretende mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y  expandir  el mercado hacia otras zonas.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Víctor es un micro crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), para comprar materiales para construir otros tanques para aumentar la producción de tilapia ,   lo que le permitirá  obtener mayores ingresos económicos.

Don Víctor es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 64 year old man man living in a community called Osa located in Caña Blanca in Puntarenas Province.  This community stands out because it’s a rural zone that gets many visitors due to its beaches.  Its main economic activities are tourism, farming and raising livestock.

Víctor raises tilapias, an edible product in the zone where he lives and in other parts of the country.  With the tilapia project he can improve his family’s quality of life and expand his market into other zones.

What Víctor needs at the moment is a one million colones micro loan to buy materials to build more tanks to increase tilapia production which will allow him to earn higher income.

Víctor is a member of the Caña Blanca communal bank, one of Edesa’s 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.  With this loan he expects to grow more both personally and economically.  He also points out that thanks to this type of organization and mean of facilitating credit he will be able to dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: to build tanks for a tilapia hatchery.

loans.name: Estrellia Azul Group

texts.es:
El comité Estrellita Azul nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.  Ellas mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Vicenta  es una mujer casada, tiene 2 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación y determinación de salir adelante. Ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida con la cual surte a las personas de su barrio, y es gracias a este negocio que ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecerlo con  carne, leche, huevos, gaseosas, jugos, yerba y demás insumos de primera necesidad, que son los que más salida tienen. Vicenta, tanto como se grupo está muy contentas de poder formar parte del programa de la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The Estrellita Azul lending club was born through the management and support of another club that was working in the same place. This lending group is from the city of San Lorenzo and the members' main objective is each of their growth - not only economic, but also personal. They are recognized in their town as very hardworking women.

Vicenta is married and has two children. She is an innovative entrepreneur, and during all of these lending cycles she has demonstrated a desire to overcome and a determination to get ahead. She tells us that she has a well-stocked store that supplies the people in her neighborhood. Thanks to this business she has been able to help her husband with the day-to-day costs of their household.

She is asking for a loan to be able to stock up on meat, milk, eggs, sodas, juices, yerba and other basic goods that sell out most quickly. Vicenta, like the rest of the group, is very happy to be part of the Fundacion Paraguaya program.

loans.use: to buy meat, milk, eggs, sodas, juices, yerba and other products.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, se han unido con el deseo de trabajar juntas y por medio de este trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras.  Son todas amigas y vecinas de barrio que vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una grana ayuda para ellas y sus familias.
Geronima es una de las miembros del grupo, y nos cuenta que se dedica al bordado de zapatillas de todas clases. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que la zapatilla bordada últimamente  se vende mucho entre las clientas. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas, lentejuelas, perlas, hilos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las zapatillas que ella vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso have joined up with a desire to work together and, through their work, help one another. They are all friends and neighbors who saw that the Fundacion Paraguaya program would be a great help to them and their families.

Geronima is one of the members. She tells us that she embroiders all kinds of slippers. She says it's going well because the embroidered shoes are selling well lately. Her goal is to keep working and continue helping her family.

She asks for a loan to buy slippers, sequins, pearls, thread and other inputs to keep making the slippers that she sells. She is grateful for the opportunity from Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sequins, pearls, thread and other inputs.

loans.name: Ñasaindy Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Ñasaindy, las miembros han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar siempre con  mutuo respeto y honestidad. Actualmente se encuentran en el  cuarto ciclo con 10 miembros, quienes se esfuerzan al maximo día a día.
Agustina es costurera, y cuenta que trabaja todos los días, ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos. Gracias a su trabajo, ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y tambien ayudar con los gastos que dia a dia surgen en la casa. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora, y con un gran espiritu de superacion.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y demás insumos que siempre usa en su taller de costura, pues tiene pedidos con los que quiere cumplir.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Ñasaindy. The members have made the commitment to stay united as a group and to always work with mutual respect and honesty. They are now in their fourth loan cycle and have ten members who exert themselves to the maximum day by day.

Agustina is a seamstress, and she tells us that she works every day, since she always has many orders. Thanks to her work, she has been able to help her family and also help with the day to day expenses that arise in the home. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman with a great spirit to aim ever higher. 

She is applying for the loan to purchase fabrics, thread, elastic, fasteners, and other supplies that she always uses in her sewing workshop, since she has orders that she wants to fill.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, fasteners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lucrencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Chimoio, Província de Manica, Centro de Moçambique, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais apenas 2 frequentam a Escola e os outros já formaram suas famílias. Fez 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte de seus pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 3 netos que vivem com ela. 	

Saiu de Chimoio para Maputo no Distrito de Boane quando casou, é negociante há mais de 16 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.400.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria (óleo, amendoim, farinha, sumos, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, aplicados no comércio. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negócio para satisfazer os seus clientes, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Chimoio, province of Manica, central Mozambique. She's a widow and has four children - only two of them attend school, the others have already started their own families. She completed 7th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports three grandchildren who live with her.
She left Chimoio for Maputo, in the district of Boane, when she got married. She has been a businesswoman for over 16 years. She sells various products and earns an income of about 6.400mt. She uses it to pay for home expenses and also saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 20.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise (oil, peanuts, flour, juice, etc.). The previous loans were for 15.000mt and 15.000mt, for her retail business.
She pledges to make her repayments as scheduled. In the future she plans to expand her business so that she can keep her customers satisfied. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (oil, peanuts, flour, juice, etc.).

loans.name: Isabel Castillo Martinez

texts.es: La señora Isabel de 50 años de edad, comerciante de ropa nueva, se siente muy contenta de tener  su propio tramo ubicado en uno de los mercados de la capital. Para ella el irle haciendo mejoras a su vivienda no le ha sido muy facil puesto que le ha costado muchos sacrificios, debido a que las alzas de los precios de los materiales de construccion son constante en este pais. Por otra parte señala su agradecimiento a la micro-financiera ya que tambien sin el apoyo de esta tampoco le hubiera sido posible las infraestructuras que le ha venido realizando a  su hogar. Con este prestamo construira paredes internas de su casa y seguira mejorando el techo, requiriendo de los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrin,laminas de zin, golosos, perling entre otros, misma construccion que le permitira levantar todo su hogar de concreto y eliminar las divisiones de tablas que con el tiempo se le han venido deteriorando.
texts.en:
50-year-old Isabel is a vendor of new clothing and she is very happy that she has her own stall located in one of the markets in the capital. 

For Isabel, making improvements to her home has not been easy - she has had to make many sacrifices as the prices of building materials are constantly rising in her country. 

Isabel expresses her appreciation of microfinance, as without this support she would not have been able to construct her house. She will invest this loan in building the inner walls of her home and will continue to improve the roof, which requires the following construction materials: Cement, blocks, iron, gravel, zinc sheets, bolts and beams, among others. The construction will allow her to build up her entire home in concrete and get rid of the cracks in the boards that have been deteriorating over time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction of the internal walls in her home.

loans.name: Learn To Pay Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Learn to Pay” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata. She is thirty years old. Fatmata was born in Makeni city, where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a monthly salaried worker and one of her children is attending primary school. 

Fatmata has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now. She sells dishes, coolers, glasses, plastic bowls, etc.  With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: buy home products to sell

loans.name: Sabanoh Group

texts.en:
Sallay is the leader of this group.  She was born in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. She is forty years old.  Sallay is married to a businessman and the couple has three children, one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

For more than fifteen years now, Sallay has been a businesswoman. She is currently selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil).  With the help of this loan, Sallay will be able to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve her living condition. She will use this loan to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy palm oil

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells maize in Dompoase near Elmina, which she has done for some years now. Nana is a single parent and has five dependents. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Nana will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 9 and 16 years. She also has 3 additional dependents living with her. 

In 1997, Isatu established her local foodstuff business. She began her business with the aim of getting a reliable source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business as profit.

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more local foodstuff to sell.  In the future, Isatu plans to build her own house and give a quality education to her children.   She thanks you for your support

loans.use: buy foodstuff

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 37-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and only sibling. She has owned a small café next to her town for the past 7 years. She provides customers with Internet services and sells coffee and quick snacks. 

Today, Lina is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of food provisions needed such as coffee, chocolates, chips, etc.  She has high hopes for the future of her business and always behaves with a positive attitude.

loans.use: buy provisions to sell in her Internet cafe

loans.name: Peter Conteh

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Peter.  He is married and has 4 children, aged 21, 19, 18 and 5 years. He has 3 additional dependents. 

In 2007, Peter established his photocopy, desktop and Internet Café business. He began his business because he noticed this type business was not in his community and a lot of people needed this service.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Peter would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy a used photocopying machine. In the future, Peter plans to open another shop to get more profit.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy a used photocopying machine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Josephine. She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 11 years.  

In 2005 Josephine established her charcoal and wood business. She began her business because after her education there was no job available, so she needed to be self-employed.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Josephine would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to build up her business.  In the future, Josephine plans to build her own house to live in with her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Abdul Bangura

texts.en:
This is 33-year-oldld Abdul. He is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 6 years.  He has 2 additional dependents who live with him for schooling.  

In 2006, Abdul established his business selling Top-Ups (cell phone service reloads) and all kinds of mobile  phone accessories, as well as movies, etc. He began his business because he was earning a very low salary and needed an extra source of income to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 from this business. 

Abdul would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy different brands of mobile phones and their accessories. In the future, Abdul plans to open other centers that will be managed by his wife. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina operates a grocery shop in Mpohr near Takoradi. This she has done for 10 year now. The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc. She is married and has six children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Faustina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El Señor Cesar es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive con sus padres, tiene 29 años de edad. Él es macatero (Vendedor ambulante) vende artículos de mercerías y medicamentos en Gral., también es dueño de una orquesta musical, que toca para distintos tipos de eventos.
El se define como una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante e ir progresando día con día para poder ser mejor. Su meta es seguir trabajando y así convertirse en un buen microempresario que sobresalga.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de un instrumento musical, teclado,  para la orquesta que tiene, de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo como trabajador.
texts.en:
Cesar is from the city of Santani. He lives with his parents and is 29 years old. He is a traveling salesman and sells dry goods and medications in general. He also leads an orchestra that plays at different kinds of events. 

He characterizes himself as very hardworking person who wants to get ahead and who is making progress day after day in order to become better. His goal is to continue working and thus become a good small businessman who stands out.

He is applying for a loan in order to purchase a musical instrument, a keyboard, for his orchestra. In this way, he will be able to continue working and growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a keyboard for his orchestra.

loans.name: Petience

texts.en: Petience sells secondhand ladies wear and children’s wear, which she has done for five years. She has six children and is married to a mason. She uses her to income to help her husband pay for their accommodations and utility bills. Petience needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies wear and children’s wear for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Petience will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies wear and children’s wear for sale

loans.name: Mary Ama

texts.en: Mary Ama cooks rice for sale. She serves it with macaroni, meat and fish stew. Mary has been selling cooked rice for the past five years now. She is married to a driver and has five children. Mary helps her husband pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare her food to sell. Mary will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare her food to sell

loans.name: Silvia Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia de Paccha que se encuentra situada al Noreste del cantón Cuenca, parroquia que tiene hermosos paisajes naturales, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y artesanías, muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas, su gente es amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Silvia tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Silvia hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de chumales y quimbolitos (platos típicos), los vende recorriendo en la ciudad de lunes a sábados, contando ya con una clientela seleccionada. En la su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como: cerdos y pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para los animales.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Mujeres Floreciendo communal bank.  She lives in the parish of Paccha, which is located to the northeast of the canton of Cuenca.  The parish has beautiful natural landscapes and the people there work raising animals, in agriculture, and in arts and crafts.  Many work in the city of Cuenca carrying out various jobs.  The people there are friendly and they preserve the culture and traditions of their people.

Silvia, 28, is married and from her marriage has two children, ages 10 and 8, who are in school.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession.  They do not have their own house so they rent.

Silvia has worked for nine years selling "chumales" [a type of tamal] and "quimbolitos" [a corn-based steamed dessert], traditional dishes.  She sells them all over the city from Monday through Saturday, relying on a select clientele.  At home she works raising animals such as pigs and chickens. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for seven years.  She is going to invest her new loan in buying chickens and animal feed.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Fet For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Ishiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ishiatu was born in Mattru, in southern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-five years old. Ishiatu is married to a driver and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Ishiatu sells a wide variety of items including toothpaste, toothbrushes, soaps, etc. She has been selling these items for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Ishaitu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Ishiatu will use her share of the loan (800,000.00 SLL) to buy more toothpaste, toothbrushes, and soap in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, toothbrushes, and soap in large quantities to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Na For Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Na For Pay” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Adama is the leader of this group. The thirty-eight-year-old is married to a miner and the couple has three children. Adama has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years now.  Adama sells market food like palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Abenwa

texts.en: Abenwa sell oranges and maize at Dompoase near Elmina, which she has done for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has five children.  She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe her children. Abenwa will use her loan to purchase oranges and bags of maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase oranges and bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa lives together with her husband, who is a fisherman, and 2 children at Dompoase near Elmina. Adjoa sells secondhand clothes and kenkey. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Nerida Susana

texts.es: Nerida es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros, tiene 62 años, se dedica a la venta y compra de abarrotes y comida en las ferias, ahora esta empezando con la compra y venta de cochinilla, es madre de 4 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, ella siente que ha progresado mucho en su vida familiar y personal, agradece a Finca por toda la ayuda que le dan, ella recuerda y valora que antes solo estaba en la chacra y no veía todo lo que podía realizar, al ser parte de Finca Perú ella abrió su perspectiva y ahora ve todo lo que ella logró y se alegra por las cosas que pudo hacer y todo eso es gracias al apoyo de las capacitaciones. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cochinilla.
texts.en:
Nerida is a member of the Señor de los Milagros Communal Bank. She is 62 years old and buys and sells groceries and food at street markets. Currently she is beginning to buy and sell cochineal (a red dye made from the cochineal insect). 

Nerida is the mother of four and has been a member of Finca Perú for three years. She feels she has made great progress in her personal and family life. She is grateful to Finca for all the help it has given her.  She remembers and appreciates that previously she was only on the farm and did not see everything she was capable of doing. Upon becoming a part of Finca, she broadened her perspective and now sees all that she has achieved. She is happy because of the things she was able to do, all of which is thanks to the support she received in the training workshops.

Now she will invest her loan in the purchase of cochineal.

loans.use: to purchase cochineal (a red dye made from the cochineal insect)

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba cooks kenkey* for sale. In the photo, in front of Aba is the maize she uses in preparing her kenkey. She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Dompoase near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has 7 dependents.  Aba has been in this business for 20 years now.  She uses her income for the general upkeep of their children.  Aba will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her kenkey.  

*fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, often accompanied by fried fish

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Na We Cam-Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Na We Cam II” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Emma who is the leader of this group. Emma was born in Makeni. Forty-five year old Emma is married to a trader and the couple has five children.

Emma sells market food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying a larger quantity of market-food to add to her stall.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: True Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “True Sisters” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Maritatu. Mariatu was born in Kambia, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary school. Mariatu sells provisions – milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc.. She has been a businesswoman for 17 years now. She is going to use her share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, cheese, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Together We Tinap Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Together We Tinap” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 3,000,000.00 Sierra Leone (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abdul is the leader of this group. The thirty-three-year-old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children. Abdul has been a businessman for ten years now. He sells shoes/ sandals. With his share of this loan, he will buy a large quantity of sandals to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sandals to add to his business

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Women in Action” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. Aminata is thirty four years old, married with four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Aminata sells market food like palm oil, onion, pepper, salt, fish, etc. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. With the help of this loan, Aminata will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her stall.

loans.use: to buy market food like palm oil, onion, pepper, salt, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her stall

loans.name: Rigoberto Eduardo Chacon Yarihuaman

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un joven muy luchado y empeñoso de 27 años de edad que constantemente esta exigiéndose a sí mismo para salir adelante y lograr grandes cosas. El logró terminar por completo el colegio, por lo que se siente muy orgullo y reconfortado, pero lamentablemente no pudo estudiar lo que realmente deseaba “Psicología” debido a que sus padres no podían apoyarlo por los bajos ingresos que estos ganaban.

El ha afrontado muchas circunstancias, pero con mucho empeño las ha afrontado muy bien, tales como los desastres naturales que suceden constantemente en los últimos meses, temblores muy fuertes, huaycos y lluvias, en la ciudad de Ica, Perú.

Para poder ganar el dinero que necesita se levanta todos los días muy temprano y sale a trabajar en su taxi, auto que se compró con mucho esfuerzo, mucha dedicación y pasión por lo que hace. A través del tiempo y las vivencias aprendidas, el ha logrado tomarle afecto a su trabajo, sabe que es algo a  lo que se dedica diariamente y le gusta tal como es su labor.

Rigoberto ha logrado ahorra una pequeña cantidad de dinero y con la ayuda que se le puede brindar, el podrá comprar los repuestos que tanto necesita su vehículo, ya que como conduce muchas horas al día, estas han ido deteriorándose y causándolo algunas averías a su vehículo. Con el mejor estado de su vehículo se sentirá seguro de que no le fallará y podrá continuar transportando a sus clientes hasta donde ellos deseen. El está seguro que con sus nuevos ingresos y el empeño diario que siempre ha puesto, le permitirán comprar otro carro en algunos años y así poco a poco a base de su dedicación logrará cumplir su sueño y meta “Tener una empresa de transporte”.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a very determined and hard-working young man of 27, who is constantly pushing himself to succeed and accomplish great things. He managed to complete high school, which made him feel very proud and encouraged, but unfortunately he wasn't able to study what he really wished--psychology, due to the fact his parents could not support him because of the low income they earned.

He has faced many difficult circumstances, such as natural disasters that in recent months have occurred constantly in the city of Ica, Perú: very strong tremors, landslides, and rains. But with a great deal of determination he has faced them very well.

To earn the money he needs, he gets up very early every day, and goes out to work in his taxi, a car that was purchased with much effort, dedication, and passion for what he does. With time and with what he learned from his experiences, he has gotten to love his work; he knows it is something he works at daily, and likes his work just as it is.

Rigoberto has managed to save a small amount of money, and with the help that can be offered to him, he will be able to buy the spare parts that his vehicle needs so much. Because he drives for many hours a day, these parts have been deteriorating, causing a few vehicle breakdowns.

With his vehicle in better condition, he will feel more certain that it won't let him down, and he will be able to continue transporting his customers where they wish. He is confident that with his new income and the daily effort he has always put into his work, he will be in a position to buy another car in a few years, and this way, little by little, through his dedication, he will succeed in fulfilling his dream and goal: "To have a transportation company."

loans.use: To buy parts for his car.

loans.name: God- Gee Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “God Gee” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek for a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Hawa, pictured on the left. Hawa was born in Makeni, about 27 years ago. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver and her child is still not of school-going age. Hawa has been selling onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. for 8 years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy onions, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, palm oil, pepper, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Teko-Sanda Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Teko-Sanda” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Jane is the leader of this group. Jane is 32 years old. She is married with one child. Her husband is a military officer and her child is attending primary school. Jane sells pepper, fish, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, etc.. With the help of this loan, Jane will invest in her business by buying pepper, fish, margi, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy pepper, fish, margi, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Odonbileg Majig

texts.en:
Odonbileg, 29, sells casual clothes in a shopping mall which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running this business for 5 years with his wife and usually they have a lot of customers. Now he lives with his family in his father-in-law’s apartment in the suburban district of the city.  

Initially this couple started their business by retail sales from their home and sometimes sales by phone calls around the offices.  Now he needs to increase the working capital for bigger sales volume.  It is beneficial to run their business successfully and raise their family's income. This loan he is taking will be dedicated to the purchase of more casual clothes from the suppliers.

loans.use: To the purchase of more casual clothes for increasing the sales volume

loans.name: Gerardo Daniel Espino Ormeño

texts.es:
Gerardo es un joven de 21 años, trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad conocida por sus Dunas, las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año al igual que la laguna de “Huacachina”, así como también se cultiva uno de los mejores algodones del mundo y el cultivo de espárragos. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con su amigo y sus vecinos de su barrio; también le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo escabeche (platillo a base de cebolla aderezada con ají vinagre y otros ingredientes y se le agrega una pieza de pollo); el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar odontología.

Día a día Gerardo trabaja muy duro en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi; trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque recorre muchas calles en el día en busca de clientes y sobre todo da un trato amable.

Gerardo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, con lo cual tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y más seguro para el transporte de los clientes, asi los clientes tendrán más confianza al tomar sus servicios y le permitirá seguir trabajando para realizar su gran sueño:”comprarse un automóvil”
texts.en:
Gerardo is a young man of 21 years, and an enthusiastic worker.  He lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its sand dunes, which are visited extensively by tourists year-round, as well as Lake Huacachina.  Some of the best cotton and asparagus in the world are grown there.  

In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also likes to indulge in one of his favorite dishes, which is the very rich escabeche (a dish with a base of onion seasoned with chili vinegar and other ingredients, with a piece of chicken added).  

He has a fifth-grade education, but he would have liked to study dentistry.  Daily, Gerardo works very hard at his rickshaw business, where he is  a driver.  He works about eight hours a day and can attend to as many as 30 customers in a day.  He believes he does well with his business because he covers a lot of streets during the day in search of customers and, above all, he treats them well.  

Gerardo is very grateful for Kiva’s loans.  Thanks to that support, he has been able to maintain his vehicle, ensuring its good condition, so that his clients will have more confidence in using his services and allowing him to continue working so he can reach his big dream:  “to buy himself a car”.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Luis Lapeira Torres

texts.es: Luis de 48 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 5 años; allí  se dedica al oficio de fotografía profesional en eventos, como cumpleaños, grados, primeras comuniones etc. Inicialmente aprendió a través de un amigo y posteriormente se dedicó a especializarse mediante la formación  en cursos específicos, lo cual le ha permitido el perfeccionamiento de su trabajo y se dedicó con ello a  captar una clientela, que hoy lo identifica en la ciudad. Como su  meta es tener su propio estudio y un almacén de accesorios asociados, su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios como estuches, suvenires, portarretratos y adecuará su propio estudio fotográfico. Con esta inversión logrará continuar impulsando su negocio y muy seguramente aumentará y diversificará sus servicios, lo cual es  lo que traerá mayores utilidades y por consiguiente el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Luis is 48 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and his two children, ages 4 and 5 years.  He makes a living as a professional photographer at events such as birthdays, graduations, first communions, etc.  

He originally learned through a friend and later was able to specialize through a combination of specific courses, which has allowed him to perfect his work and devote himself to building clientele, which today helps him stand out in the city.
