She hopes that she’ll do better and will use the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make the bread like: flour, oil, shortening, sugar, etc.  She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan.  She hopes the business will continue growing like it’s done to date.  She is grateful for the support provided.

Juanita belongs to the “San Juan” group which is composed of one man and 17 women who are hardworking people with small businesses of different types that we mention here:  María, María del Carmen, Noel, Miroslava, Silveria, Dominga, Ramira, Elvira, Yeni Leni, Elizabeth, María, Exaelia, Victoria, Sofía, Yamislet, Abasita and Anastasia all have commercial activities like sale of vegetables, bread, fruit, candy, groceries and farm products like beans, corn, etc.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Las Orquidias Group

texts.es:
El grupo orquídeas se encuentra en un lugar llamado Ejido de Santiago esta conformado por 12 personas muy trabajadoras 10 mujeres y dos hombres que se dedican a la ganadería el grupo se llama a si porque anteriormente estaban participando en otro crédito y así se llamaba el grupo y fue como se quedo el nombre.
La señora Alicia tiene 55 años de edad está casada desde hace 35 años con el señor Gustavo quien trabaja de empleado en una compañía ya no tiene niños que dependan de ellos, Doña Alicia se dedica a la crianza de cerdos ella se encarga de limpiarlos, darles de comer, para cuando los animales estén ya crecidos los pueda vender, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para poder comprar 12 cerdos y lo que quede será para alimento comenta que en la actividad lleva ya 6 años inicio su actividad ya que es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora entonces quería tener otro ingreso para su familia.
La única dificultad a la que se enfrenta es cuando los cerdos enferman y mueren porque es una perdida muy grande para la familia.
Una meta de doña Alicia es que su actividad con los cerdos siga creciendo porque las ganancias les beneficia mucho a ella y a su familia por lo que Doña Alicia y el resto del grupo están muy agradecido con FRAC y Kiva por la préstamo otorgado porque gracias a el podrán invertir y sus ganancias serán mayores.
Los integrantes del grupo invertirán: María del Carmen, Jaime, Joaquín, Carmen, Ofelia, Celinda, Amalia, Susana  invertirán  en borregos, Guadalupe en una becerra, Victoria invertirá en cerdos.
texts.en:
The Orquídeas (Orchids) group can be found in a place called Ejido de Santigago.  The group is comprised of 12 hardworking people, 10 women and 2 men.  They devote themselves to raising cattle.  They gave their group this name because they were previously participating with another loan, and that was what the group was called.  That is how the name stayed the same.

Alicia, age 55, has been married to Gustavo for 35 years.  He works as an employee in a company.  They do not have children who are still dependent upon them.

Alicia raises pigs.  She takes charge of cleaning and feeding them so that she will be able to sell them when they are grown.

This time she has requested a loan to be able to buy 12 pigs.  She says that the rest of the loan will be used to buy feed.  She has been engaged in this business activity for six years.  She started this business because she is a responsible and very hard-working person.  She wanted to have another income for her family.

The only difficulty that she faces is when the pigs get sick and die.  This is a big loss for the family.  One of Alicia’s goals is for her pig business to keep growing because the income is of great benefit to her and to her family.  

Alicia and the rest of the group are very grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the loan that was granted.  Thanks to the loan they will be able to invest in their businesses, and they will have greater income.  The members of the group that will invest are María del Carmen, Jaime, Joaquín, Carmen, Ofelia, Celinda, and Amalia.  Susana will buy in a sheep, Guadalupe a calf, and Victoria will buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Umaru Fullah Kargbo

texts.en: This is 26 year-old Umaru. He is single and has no children. In 2010, Umarr established his business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000. Umaru has already received and successfully repaid his first loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans and crepe fabric.  He will use the balance of Le 100,000 to pay for transportation. In the future, Umaru plans to expand his business, engage in further studies and build a house. The loan will help him to have more stock. His challenges are fluctuation in foreign currencies. He is a hardworking businessman. He prays that there will be no stumbling blocks in the repayment. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans and crepe fabric, and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru:
Мире 51 год, вдова, воспитала 5 детей. В 1995 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Мира начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Миры на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 3 головы бычков, 5 головы овец и 1 голова лошади. Доходы от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляют примерно 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Мира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Mira is 51 years old, a widow and raised five children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1995, starting this business with an initial amount of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today Mira's business contains two dairy cows, three bulls, five sheep and one horse. The earnings from sales of milk and meat products amount to about 6,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Mira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a farmer working in San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children aged twenty-six and twenty-two.  Susan’s husband works as a farmer as well.

Susan has been in the rice farming business for ten years. She earns PHP 4,000 per month through farming.  Susan has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labour.  Susan hopes this loan will help increase their harvest.  Susan also hopes to expand their farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labour for her farm.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо проживает в районе Дангара. Она замужем. Ей 33 года. У нее четверо детей. Мархабо занимается торговлей женской и детской одежды. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Marhabo lives in the Dangara district.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children.  Marhabo is involved in selling women's and children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Manot

texts.ru: Манот уже два года занимается животноводством. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Он берет кредит для закупа теленка.
texts.en: Manot has been involved in animal husbandry for two years.  She is 41 years old, married and has six children.  She is requesting this loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru:
Нуриле 56 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. В 2008 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Нурила начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Нурилы на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 50 голов овец, 2 головы лошади, заготовлено 4 тележки сена и 1 тонна ячменя. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Nurila is 56 years old, married and raised three children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 2008, starting this business with an initial amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Today Nurila's business contains two dairy cows, fifty sheep and two horses, and has a stock of four loads of hay and one ton of barley.  In order to further develop her business, Nurila requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fidelite De Dieu Group

texts.fr:
Lauraine est le coordinatrice de son groupe  FIDELITE DE DIEU du Cape Haitien, la région nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle n'est pas marié elle n'a pas d'enfants.

Lauraine a dirigé son commerce produit de beaute pendant les 3 dernières années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce Lauraine, etait un etudiante. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans ventes produits cosmetique.

Lauraine espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de fidelite  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmetiques. Lauraine dit que son défi principal c'est d'avoir plus d'argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Lauraine dit que son rêve c'est d'avoir constuire une maison.
texts.en:
Lauraine is the coordinator of the  Fidelite de Dieu group of   Cap-Haïtien [coast], a region in the north of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and access to water very limited. She is single without children. She has been running a beauty products business for three years.  Before launching this business, Lauraine was a student. She would like to use this loan to buy cosmetic products for resale.

Lauraine hopes that this loan will allow her to  expand her business. The other group members also need loans for their businesses, such as selling groceries and cosmetic products. Lauraine says that her main challenge is to have a bigger capital in order to grow her business.
Her  dream is to have a house built.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Elisa is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, ages 8, 5 and 3. Her husband works as a fisherman and carpenter.

Elisa is a food vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells bananas and camote cue (deep-fried sweet potato covered with caramelized brown sugar), and rice cakes. Elisa also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business located at her house. 

Elisa works hard to support her husband in providing for their family’s needs and sending their children to school. She applied for a loan to purchase sugar, flour, bananas, and more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. Elisa hopes to earn better and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, bananas, and more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is an 18-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She started a food vending business a year ago. Marissa sells banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar), camote (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes, and ice candy. She earns about 3,500 PHP per month with her business. Marissa does her best to support her husband and save for their future.

Marissa has requested a loan to buy bananas, camote, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. Marissa hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, camote (sweet potatoes), sugar, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en: Dioscoro is a 42-year-old married man with three children ages 20, 16 and 12.  Dioscoro makes "tuba" (coconut wine) and vinegar to earn a living. Dioscoro earns about 3,500 PHP per month with this business.  Dioscoro owns a coconut farm, which is the source of his wine and vinegar.  Dioscoro works hard to increase his earnings and sustain his children's education.  He plans to use his loan to buy containers and food coloring.  Dioscoro hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his wine and vinegar making business.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
El grupo de las Artesanas del Fresno está ubicado en  Fresno Nichi un lugar donde los arboles predominan, el grupo está conformado por 9 mujeres todas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías que es el bordado, precisamente el grupo se llama Las Artesanas del Fresno Artesanas por la actividad a la que se dedican y fresno por el lugar donde viven.
Doña Rufina tiene 52 años de edad esta casada desde hace 32 años con el señor Santiago quien trabaja de obrero y agricultor aun tienen un niño  Aron Santiago que depende de ellos el cual está estudiando la primaria.
Doña Rufina se dedica al bordado nos cuenta que ya hace 32 años que se dedica a bordar, colchas, gabanes, chales, esquemesnes, tapetes con figuras representativas de la comunidad, las cuales son estrellas de trencillas, bordados de casita, figuras de caballo, y otros animalitos con el crédito otorgado doña Rufina comprara tela de lana, tela estambron, estambre de madeja para bordar, aujas, tijeras, etc.
Una de las dificultades mas grandes que presenta doña Rufina es que casi no se vende ya nuestra artesanía porque las personas no quieren pagar el precio a que se le da al cliente se le hace muy caro y muchas veces nuestro trabajo no es valorado como debería ser. Doña Rufina comenta que para la elaboración de dichos artículos se tardan de 20 días hasta un mes dependiendo del artículo que vayan hacer.
El préstamo que FRAC y Kiva les realizan al grupo de las Artesanas del Fresno es de gran ayuda ya que muchas veces no tiene para comprar sus materiales para la elaboración de sus actividades.
Por lo que ellas están muy agrdecidas por el préstamo otorgado por lo que resto del grupo invierte en: Angelina, Maria Juana, Lucina, Maria de los Angeles, Leonila, Maria Lucina invertiran en bordados de artesanias y Maria Iris en productos de Belleza.
texts.en:
The “Las Artesanas del Fresno” (The Ash Tree Artisans) group is located in Fresno Nichi a place where trees predominate.  It’s composed of nine women who are all embroidery craftswomen.  The group is called Las Artesanas del Fresno precisely because of the activity they carry out and ‘fresno’ because of the place they live in.

Rufina, 52, has been married to Santiago, who works as a laborer and farmer, for 32 years; they still have a little boy, Aron Santiago, who depends on them and is attending elementary school.

Rufina is an embroiderer and she mentions that she’s been doing this for 32 years; she embroiders bedspreads, ponchos, shawls, "quexquemetl" [embroidered lace cape], mats with figures representative of the community such as braided stars, embroidered little houses, horses and other little animals.  With the granted loan, Rufina will buy wool fabric, embroidery fabric, Madeja-style yarn, needles, scissors, etc.

One of Rufina’s greatest difficulties is that their type of crafts hardly sell anymore because people don’t want to pay the prices quoted to customers; they think they are too expensive and often their work is undervalued.  Rufina relates that it takes from 20 days to a month depending on the item to be made to complete said items.

The loan that FRAC and Kiva will provide for the Las Artesanas del Fresno group is of great help for them because often they are unable to buy the materials they need to make their items.  Because of this, they are very grateful for the loan granted that the entire group will invest:  Angelina, Maria Juana, Lucina, Maria de los Angeles, Leonila, Maria and Lucina will invest in their artisanal embroidery work and Maria Iris in beauty products.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 49 years old and married with three children, ages 20, 18 and 13.  Anecita's husband does coastal fishing.

Anecita has had a sari-sari store for 16 years.  She sells items like biscuits, cooking oil, vinegar, canned goods and spices.  Anecita has a monthly income of 6,000 PHP from her store.  She is doing her best to support her family, especially with her children's education.

Anecita is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods.  Anecita hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esperanza De Vida Group

texts.es:
Áurea cuenta con 42 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo que cursa 3° de preparatoria, ella se dedica al comercio venta de comida antojitos como son: tacos, quesadillas, tostadas, chicharrones, tiene 3 años con el negocio lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio y invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos como son: verduras, tortillas, carne, choriso, chicharrones, etc. En la venta le ayuda su hijo juntos están saliendo adelante y espera que sea una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su  hijo a ser un gran profesionista. 

Áurea pertenece a un grupo llamado esperanza de vida el cual esta integrado por 3 hombres y 7 mujeres en totalidad son 10 miembros los cuales son unas personas comprometidas con el trabajo y salir cada día adelante todos tienen un negocio pequeños y trabajan día a día para incrementarlo a continuación serán mencionados: Alfonso, Ricardo, María de los Ángeles, Ismael, Rosa del Carmen, Alejandra, Agustina, Cecilia, Yanet, todas cuenta con actividades comerciales como son: ropa, venta de calzado, ropa por catalogo, dulces, pollos, venta de papelería, venta de sal, compra de semillas.
texts.en:
Áurea, age 42, is a single mother and has a son in his third year of high school.  She sells fast food snacks like tacos, quesadillas, tostadas, and chicharrones (fried pork rinds).  She has had her business for three years, and she says it is going very well for her in the business.

She will use the loan to buy supplies like vegetables, tortillas, meat, sausages, and chicharrones, etc.  Her son helps her with sales, and together they are getting ahead.  She hopes that it will be a source of income to help her son become a great professional.

Áurea belongs to a group named “Esperanza de Vida” (Hope of Life), which is comprised of three men and seven women, ten members in all.  They are people who are committed to the work and to getting ahead each day.  All of them have small businesses, and they work day to day in order to augment them.

The members are Alfonso, Ricardo, María de los Ángeles, Ismael, Rosa del Carmen, Alejandra, Agustina, Cecilia, and Yanet.  All of them have commercial activities like selling shoes, clothes by catalog, sweets, chickens, stationery goods, salt, and buying seeds.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tortillas, meat, sausages, and chicharrones, etc.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Lilibeth cuenta con 27 años de edad, es casada tiene dos hijos los cuales son muy pequeños el mayor se llama Julio de 3 años y lizeth de 1 año su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende pan el cual dice que le ha funcionado muy bien con la ayuda de su esposo, ya tiene 2 años con el negocio y dice que ya le sabe muy bien de sus ganancias e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de pan para revenderlo el cual se lo pasan a menos precio para así ella tenga ganancias ella espera que le vaya muy bien para así ir incrementando el negocio poco a poco y salir adelante.

Lilibeth pertenece al grupo llamado san marcos nombre del lugar donde son originarios y están viviendo el grupo esta integrado por  12 personas dos hombres y 10 mujeres los cuales todos cuentan con una actividad comercial como son: Martha, Luisa, Ma Juana, Yoady, Antonia, Yaxiltun, Gabriel, Benjamín, Mercedes, Juana, María Elena, todas las actividades comerciales  son: venta de pan, mercería, productos de abarrotes, taller de reparación de calzado, perfumes, venta de calzado, refrescos y dulces, pescadería, etc.
texts.en:
Lilibeth is 27 years old.  She is married with two children, who are very young.  The oldest is called Julio and is three years old, and Lizeth is one year old.  Lilibeth's husband works in retail.

Lilibeth works in retail.  She sells bread, which she says she bakes well with the help of her husband.  She has had her business for two years, and says that she has good knowledge of her earnings. She will invest her loan in purchasing bread at a lower price for resale, so that she can make profits.  She hopes that things will go well so that she can build her business bit by bit and move ahead in life.

Lililbeth belongs to the group called "San Marcos", which is the name of the place the group members are from and where they live.  The group is made up of twelve people: two men and ten women.  They all have retail activities.  They are: Martha, Luisa, Ma Juana, Yoady, Antonina, Yaxiltun, Gabriel, Benjamín, Mercedes, Juana, and María Elena.  Their retail activities are: selling bread, merchandise, groceries, a shoe repair workshop, perfumes, shoe sales, sodas and sweets, fish, etc.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing sweet bread.

loans.name: Songtita Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNATA  est la représentante du groupe SONGTITA. Elle est mariée et mère de  04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans  et le moins âgé a 01an.02 vont  à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du savon  depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché  de secteur 10  en ville. Ses clients sont  les gens de son quartier

 Mme veut  s’acheter  04 cartons de savon.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider son mari dans les charges familiales. Mme ambitionne ouvrir sa   propre boutique pour son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. MAMOUNATA is the representative of the group SONGTITA. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 11 years old, and the youngest is 1. Two of the children go to school. She has four persons to support. 

Ms. MAMOUNATA has been selling soap for ten years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are the people in her district. She would like to buy four boxes of soap. 

With the profits, she wants to help her husband to cover family expenses. Her ambition is to open her own store for her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of soap

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina has had a sari-sari business for three years.  She sells items like biscuits, vinegar, soy sauce, eggs and canned goods.  Carolina earns about 7,000 PHP with her store.  She also helps her husband cultivate their land and plant rice crops on it.

Carolina is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as biscuits, detergent soap and canned goods.  Carolina hopes to expand her sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: purchase items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ikenna

texts.fr:
Ikenna est un homme âgé de 26ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Ikenna travaille comme revendeur de pièces détachées depuis 2009. Il vend dans une boutique et achète à Lomé et au Nigéria.
Ikenna a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pièces détachées moto. Il veut bien vendre afin d’assurer sa future vie maritale.
texts.en:
Ikenna is a 26-years-old man, unmarried, and without children. He has been working as a retailer of replacement parts since 2009. He sells out of a store and makes his purchases in Lomé and in Nigeria. 

Ikenna has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy some parts for motorbikes. He really wants to provide for a life of marriage in the future.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de détergents depuis 2011. Elle vend à Lomé et s’approvisionne au même lieu.
Afi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des détergents. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is a 35-years-old woman who is married to a driver. She has two children. Afi has been working as a retailer of detergents since 2011. She makes her sales in Lomé and gets her supplies at the same place. 

Afi has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy some detergents. She wants to reinvest in her business and to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy detergents

loans.name: El Gs De Los Colores Group

texts.es:
Santa cuenta con 48 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo el cual se llama Óscar él se encuentra estudiando 1º grado de preparatoria. Ella es maestra da clases en una secundaria en un puelo vecino, también se dedica al comercio vende comida en el mercado vende bolillos rellenos de puercos, ella vive en una comunidad muy tranquila llamado las vigas con su hijo de 17 años, y ahora esta vendiendo mas ya que su pueblo de esta fiesta la feria tradicional, Santa invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos para elaborar la comida como son: aceite, verduras, carne, etc. ahora solo espera que le ayude a mejorar su negocio ya que le gustaría que su negocio creciera y establecer una local con una fonda para vender y desayunos espera hacer que tanto quiere y echarle muchas ganas esta súper agradecida.

Santa pertenece al grupo el GS de los colores el cual esta integrado por 6 mujeres y dos hombres todos cuentan con un negocio a continuación serán mencionados: José Alfredo tiene un atienda de calzado y ropa, Adelina venta de ropa, Maria venta de calzado y bolsas de damas y caballeros, Eva venta de carnicería, José Armando servicios de transporte, Yumayra venta de ropa y Sandy Luz venta de mariscos todos esperan que le vaya muy bien.
texts.en:
Santa is 48 years old and single.  He has a son named Óscar who attends first-grade at preparatory school.  Santa is a teacher at a secondary school in a nearby village, and she also works selling food in the market; she sells rolls stuffed with pork.  She lives in a very tranquil community called "Las Vigas" with her 17-year-old child, and she is currently selling more because her village is celebrating its traditional holiday.

Santa will invest her loan in purchasing ingredients for making her food, such as oil, vegetables, meat, etc.  She only hopes now that it will help her improve her business as she would like her business to grow and to set up premises with a restaurant where she can sell her food and breakfasts.  She hopes to be able to make everything happen that she wants, and is super grateful to be looking forward to this.

Santa belongs to the group "El GS de los Colores", which is made up of six women and two men.  They all have businesses as follow: José Alfredo has a store selling shoes and clothing; Adelina sells clothing; Maria sells shoes and bags for men and women; Eva has a butchers; José Armando provides transportation services; Yumayra sells clothing; and Sandy Luz sells shellfish.  All of them hope that things go very well.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing ingredients such as oil, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Yayra Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YAYRA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Jeanne est mariée à un certain Eric. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui est à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Jeanne exerce son activité de coiffure depuis une douzaine d'année. Parallèlement, Jeanne vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YAYRA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group YAYRA comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the fourth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Jeanne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She dropped out of secondary school and then learned how to style hair. 

Jeanne is married to a man named Eric. They have one child, who is in school and in their care. Jeanne lives together with her child and husband, and she jointly ensures the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To ensure the expenses are covered, Jeanne has been running a hair salon for about twelve years. At the same time, she sells hair extensions and cosmetic products. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

Seeing to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Jeanne, along with the other members of her group YAYRA, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products

loans.name: Abdel Jalil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, is married, and has three children, who all of them work.

Abdel Jalil has been an owner of a food market since 2000, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, with a deep understanding of local customers and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to purchase split air conditioner and generator, and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase split air conditioner and generator and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Najlaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children.

Najlaa has been a tailor since 2000; she professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and dresses for women. She has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. She has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a 2,000 USD loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine and an electrical generator. She hopes to gain more profits in order to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and an electrical generator.

loans.name: Dédévi

texts.fr:
Dédévi est une femme âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 03 enfants.
Dédévi vend seule à domicile depuis 2009 du maïs et des charbons de bois. Ses marchandises sont achetées à Mango (une localité située au nord du Togo à environ 550km de la ville de Lomé).
Dédévi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des maïs et des sacs de charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dédévi is a 37-year-old woman who is married to a teacher. She has three children. By herself, Dédévi has been selling corn and charcoal out of her house since 2009. Her merchandise is purchased in Mango (a town located in northern Togo and about 550 km from the city of Lomé). 

Dédévi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy some corn and sacks of charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business and to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr:
Adjoavi est une femme âgé(e) de 38ans. Adjoavi travaille comme revendeuse de maïs et farine de blé depuis 2007. Elle vend à toutes personnes dans un marché de la place et achète à Lomé. Sa difficulté est la mévente. 
Adjoavi a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine, du maïs et autres. Elle veut augmenter son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjoavi voudrait devenir une grossiste dans la distribution de céréales et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is a 38-years-old woman who has been working as a retailer of corn and wheat flour since 2007. She sells to anyone at a local market and makes her purchases in Lomé. Her difficulty is a drop in sales. 

Adjoavi has requested a second loan from WAGES to buy flour, corn, and more. She wants to increase her business. In the next few years, she would like to become a wholesale merchant distributing grains. And she wants to do better supporting herself.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat flour, and cassava flour

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в районе Дангара. Он женат. Ему 33 года. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Dangara district.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in animal husbandry and has been in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru:
Айнуре 45 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Айнура работает учителем математики в местной школе и в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается животноводством. Начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Айнура смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 15,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В хозяйстве Айнуры на сегодняшний  день имеется  6 дойных коров, 10 голов овец, 2 головы лошади. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Ainura is 45 years old, married and raised three children.  She works as a mathematics teacher at a local school and is involved in animal husbandry to provide an additional source of income.  Having started this business with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Ainura was able to develop her business to have a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and milk products.  Today, her business contains six dairy cows, ten sheep and two horses.  In order to further develop her business, Ainura requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 25-year-old married man, owner of an agricultural tractor that is his essential source for living.

Hassan is a hardworking man with a good reputation in the area. Hassan has worked in this business for 15 years. He was very young when he started this business to help his parents in their living.
 
Hassan didn't live a very happy childhood since he was supposed to help his parents instead of playing and enjoying his time with his friends.
 
Agriculture filled his childhood. That's why he is an expert in his field. He also works in construction, in cement work, to make extra income.

Hassan is working hard to help his own children avoid the hard childhood he experienced. To improve his business, Hassan applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance for his tractor, which he has to take care of because it represents his whole business.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his tractor.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and living with his wife and two school-aged children. In order to live properly and be able to pay his children’s study fees, Mahmoud works hard and non-stop. He’s an independent constructor specializing in floor covering and has been working in this domain since 2007. 

Today, Mahmoud is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase construction tools for his business. He notes that this will facilitate his work and let him take more projects without facing problems. In the future, he plans to renew his tools and take bigger projects.

loans.use: buy construction tools

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parent and his only working sibling. With his brother's support, he was capable of satisfying his family's needs. 

In 2008, Fares started working in repairing computers from his home. He also visits his customers from time to time. Today he has the intention to take a youth loan from Kiva Partner, Ameen s.a.l., to renew his tools and purchase new ones. This Kiva loan will allow him to continue his work in a proper way. In the future, he plans to open his own computer shop.

loans.use: to renew his tools and purchase new ones.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 25-year-old married woman. She lives in Lebanon with her husband. They depend on each other in order to live their life properly. Caroline's husband works in the Lebanese army. As for her, she has owned a men’s clothing shop since 2009. 

Today, in order to increase her revenue, she decided to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase the new spring and summer collection for her shop. In that way, she will be able to satisfy all her customers. 

In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop and boost her profits.

loans.use: to purchase the new spring and summer collection for her shop.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and five siblings. His father is considered as the main income provider of the family. But since there are heavy expenses to cover, Abbas decided to start working at a very young age to provide his family with extra financial support. His job consists in buying wood for heating and reselling it to customers from his town. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase more wood to sell. He notes that this business generates him good profits; and in the future, he plans to further expand his work and open his own business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en: Jawad is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He is living with his parents and two siblings. In 2010, he started to work repairing air conditioners and ventilators. In addition, he specialized in repairing refrigerators. Jawad is very satisfied with his new job and he's pleased with the idea of making his business a success, especially after seeing a need for such services in the region. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to purchase new tools needed to make his repair services much easier to implement. In the future, he plans to open his own air–conditioning shop.

loans.use: to purchase new tools needed to make his repair services much easier to implement

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is a 21-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and two siblings, one of them is working.  Her father is the one responsible for satisfying his family's needs. 

Silia has been working at a local company since 2010.  She’s brave and is capable of improving herself.  Silia is looking to continue her education, so she asks today for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay the rest of her university fees.  This will allow her to carry on her studies in a proper way.  In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and pursue her Master’s degree.

loans.use: pay her university fees

loans.name: Kurbonsho

texts.ru: Курбоншо проживает в районе Дангара. Он женат. Ему 55 лет. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Шесть лет как занимается торговлей. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает женскую и мужскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Kurbonsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 55 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary education.  Kurbonsho has been involved in sales for six years.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells women's and men's clothing.  He is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Zacapalco Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 2 hijos varones el mayor estudia la secundaria y el pequeño tiene 2 años, ella vende tamales, pan y yogurt, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar manteca, harina, mantequilla, azúcar, levadura, maíz, carne, manteca de puerco, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, ella contrato a un panadero y vio como elaboraba el pan y asi aprendio a elaborar el pan y su mama le enseño a hacer los tamales, a ella le gusta elaborar el pan y venderlo, ella ofrece a sus clientes pan de dulce, teleras, pan de feria de nuez y pasas y tamales, su negocio es importante porque obtiene ingresos para su hijo que está estudiando, ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio que era una sociedad pero no aguantaron los socios y ella se quedo con su negocio, sus sueños y esperanzas son construir unos cuartos para sus hijos y arregla el baño y que sus hijos estudien y tengan una carrera, los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por  apoyarnos con los prestamos, porque nos ayudan a salir adelante".
La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Verónica quien triene un puesto de dulces
texts.en:
Señora Norma is 35 years old.  She is married with two sons.  The elder is attending secondary school, and the younger is two years old.  

Norma sells tamales, bread and yogurt.  She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, butter, sugar, yeast, corn, meat, and lard.  She started her business four years ago.  She signed on with a baker and saw how to prepare bread, and in this way she learned to bake bread and her mom taught her to make tamales.  She enjoys baking bread and selling it.  She sells her customers sweet bread, rolls, holiday bread with nuts and raisins, and tamales.  Her business is important to her, because she gets income for her son who is attending school.  She is proud of her business, which used to be a partnership, but the partners didn't work out, so she left the partnership and kept the business.  Her dreams and hopes are to build some rooms for her sons, and to repair the bathroom.  She also dreams and hopes for her sons to study and have a career.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “we thank you for helping us with these loans, because they are helping us to move forward in life."

The photo was taken at Señora Verónica's business, which is a sweet stall.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, sugar, yeast, corn, meat, and lard.

loans.name: Pikpiriyem

texts.fr:
Pikpiriyem est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un  médecin.  Elle a 04 enfants. 
Pikpiriyem travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et de céréales depuis 1990. Elle exerce son activité seule à domicile et dans un marché de la place.
Pikpiriyem a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des charbons. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et s'occuper de son foyer.
texts.en:
Pikpiriyem is a 39-year-old woman who is married to a doctor. She has four children. She has been working as a retailer of charcoal and grains since 1990. She operates her business alone out of her home and at a local market. 

Pikpiriyem has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy grain and some charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business and to take care of her home.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ninaka

texts.fr:
Ninaka est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un professeur. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 9 ans.  
Ninaka travaille comme revendeuse de fufu( nourriture préparée à base d’ignames pilées qui s'accompagne avec la sauce blanche ou sauce tomate) depuis 2011. Elle vend avec 03 personnes dans un bar et s’approvisionne à LOME. 
Ninaka a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter  des ignames, de la tomate, de la viande. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ninaka voudrait ouvrir un autre bar. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit des meilleures conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ninaka is a 39-year-old woman who is married to a teacher. She has three children, all in school. The first one is 15 years old, and the last is 9. Ninaka has been working as a seller of <i>fufu<i/> (food made from pounded yams and served with white sauce or tomato sauce) since 2011. She makes her sales with three persons in a pub and gets her supplies in Lomé. 

Ninaka has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy yams, tomatoes, and meat. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, she would like to open another pub. She says she plans on using the profits for improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розия жительница района Дангара. Она заведена. Ей 31 год. У нее двое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Она сама занимается торговлей. Розия рядом с домом открыла магазин, где она продает женскую одежду и ткани. В этой области она три года. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Roziya is a resident of the Dangara district.  She is 31 years, divorced and has two children, all of whom are small.  She is involved in sales by herself.  Roziya opened a store near her home, where she sells women's clothing and fabrics.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Mr. Batbold, who is 47, runs a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar city, the capital city of Mongolia. He is widowed and now lives with his mother and daughter in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. His monthly earning is not enough for his family's necessities. He has been running his business, which his father initially taught him, since 2003. 

Now Batbold needs to renovate his taxi car for better service quality. He says that it will influence him to improve his business and increase his earnings. He will repair and renovate his car by himself this spring. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing spare parts for his car renovation.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to renovate his car.

loans.name: Wendzoodo Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est la responsable du groupe WENDZOODO NOOMA. Elle est mariée et mère  de 03 enfants. Le plus âgée a 35ans et le moins âgée a 15ans. 02 de ses enfants vont à l’école  et  elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend du beure de karité  depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces du Burkina. Ses clients sont  ceux qui fabriquent le savon.

Mme veut  s’acheter  120 plats de beure de karité.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices  pour renforcer son activité de vente de beure de karité. Mme ambitionne  avoir des clients à  l’extérieur qui vont acheter son produit.
texts.en:
Ms. LAMOUSSA is the official of the group WENDZOODO NOOMA. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 15. Two of the children go to school. She has three persons to support. 

Ms. LAMOUSSA has been selling shea butter for eight years. She gets her supplies from provinces in Burkina. Her customers are those who make soap. 

She wants to buy 120 slabs of shea butter. 

She uses her profits to bolster her business selling shea butter. Her ambition is to have customers from abroad who are going to buy her product.

loans.use: to buy 120 slabs of shea butter

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, who is married to a fisherman and is the mother of three children, has been a seaweed farmer for nine years now, earning about 4000 PHP per month. Daisy works hard to support her family and is now requesting her first loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straws, and wooden pegs.  She hopes to increase her income soon.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straws, and wooden pegs.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Esfuerzo” está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se dedican rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de verduras, confección de ropa, carnicería, venta de colaciones y preparación de comida rápida, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Lo Espejo, ciudad de Santiago.
Janet presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda. Viste con una polera estampada y su cabello se encuentra recogido, el cual es de color negro.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende un local en el cual vende abarrotes, bebidas y confites, desde hace tres años.
Trabaja durante todo el día, en horario continuado desde las 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 2ºº de la madrugada. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que no tiene competencia y su clientela es fija. 
Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras y en La Vega (comercio de productos del campo y abarrotes que surten diariamente tanto a los amplios comedores de restaurantes, como pequeños negocios). 
Con el crédito comprará productos para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son ampliar su negocio, ya que por ahora está ocupando una habitación de su casa y otra es habilitarlo con nueva maquinaria, ya que quiere comprar una congeladora.
Janet vive junto a su marido, su hija de 28 años y su nieto de 1 año de edad. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que ésta ayuda le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy unido y comprometido, lo cual le permite sentirse cómoda.
Las capacitaciones por su parte le han permitido organizar de mejor manera su negocio.
Lo Espejo es una  comuna ubicada en el sector sur poniente de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile). Cabe destacar que es una de las comunas con más densidad poblacional del país. El crecimiento de su población comenzó con la llegada de inmigrantes provenientes de otras regiones del país en busca de mejores horizontes, en los años ´60 y ´70, dando origen a importantes poblaciones que aún se mantienen, tales como José María Caro, Santa Adriana, Lo Valledor.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Esfuerzo” is made up of 15 entrepreneurs, who have different lines of work, like clothing sales, vegetable sales, tailoring, butcher, snack sales and fast food sales, among others. They all belong to the community of Espejo in the city of Santiago. 
Janet is the president of the group at the Communal Bank. In the photo, she is in the last row, in the 2nd place from right to left. She’s wearing a t-shirt with a print on it and she’s wearing her hair up, which is black.
She works in retail. Specifically, she’s been running a store where she sells groceries, drinks and candy for 3 years now.  
She works a long day, from 8am to 2am. She tells us that it is going very well since she has a fixed clientele and no competition.
She usually buys her goods from distributors and in La Vega (farmed goods and groceries sold every day to big restaurants and small businesses alike).
With this loan she’ll buy products to stock her business.
Her goals are to expand her business because right now the business is taking up a room in her house and to buy new appliances. She wants to buy a freezer.
Janet lives with her husband, her 28-year-old daughter and her 1-year-old grandson. One of her personal dreams is to prosper in her business so she can offer her family a better quality of life.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza because she can invest in her business. She tells us that her group is very united and committed, which makes her feel comfortable.
The training she has received has allowed her to better organize her business.
Lo Espejo is a community located in the western part of the metropolitan region (where Santiago, the capital of Chile, is). This is one of the most densely populated regions of the country. Population growth commenced when people from other parts of the country came to look for better opportunities in the 60s and 70s, giving rise to important areas like Jose Maria Caro, Santa Adriana, Lo Valledor.

loans.use: buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Safiro De Morelos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Safiro de Morelos, está conformado por las señora Celia, Socorro, Amalia Placida van a comprar con su préstamo  semilla de maíz, abono, insecticida, herbicidas, la señora Dionicia va a comprar topperware, la señora Alicia va a comprar mantequilla, huevo, gas, azúcar, cocea, mermelada, el señor Juan Carlos va a comprar zapatos de dama, caballero y niños, la señora Laura va a comprar perfumes para dama, caballero y niños, cremas, labiales, rímel, barniz, el señor Miguel Ángel va a comprar Colchas matrimoniales, individuales, cortinas, sabanas. El Joven Miguel Ángel tiene 20 años de edad, el es soltero, el vende colchas y blancos, el solicito su préstamo para comprar colchas, edredones, sabanas, almohadas, toallas, el inicio su negocio hace 1 año, le invito un tío y le pareció bueno, su negocio es ambulante sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos, su negocio es importante porque le ayuda a mejorar la forma de vida,  el se siente orgulloso de vender sus productos y conocer a otras personas, el esta feliz con este prestamo que va a recibir tiene la oportunidad de invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. El utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir en mercancía para que crezca el negocio. 
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande de colchas y blancos y lo pienza lograr con los prestamos de Kiva. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos nos sentimos seguros al saber que nos ayudan a crecer los negocios y vivir mejor con la familia”.
texts.en:
This united group is called “Safiro de Morelos” and includes Celia, Socorro, and Amalia Placida.  They will use the money from this loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and insecticide.  Dionicia will buy Tupperware.  Alicia will buy butter, eggs, cooking gas, sugar, cocoa, and jelly.  Juan Carlos will buy ladies’, men’, and children’s shoes.  Laura will buy creams, lipsticks, mascara, and nail polish.  Miguel Ángel will buy king sized bedspreads, placemats, drapes, and sheets.

Young Miguel Ángel is 20 years old, single, and sells bedspreads, and linen.  He requested a loan to buy bedspreads, quits, sheets, pillows, and towels.  He started his business one year ago after his uncle invited him and he thought it was a good idea.  He sells on foot and goes out to offer his products to his neighbors.  His business is important because it helps him improve his quality of life and he is proud to sell his products and enjoys meeting other people.  He is happy about this loan because it will give him the chance to invest and grow his business.  He will use his earnings to reinvest into merchandise so that he can grow his business.  His dreams are to have a larger bedspread and linen business and he plans to achieve this dream with the help of his Kiva loans.

The members of the group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your loans.  We feel secure knowing that you are helping us grow and live better with our families.”

loans.use: to buy linen and other things.

loans.name: Bazor

texts.ru: Базор проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его сын работает в Российской Федерации. Сам он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Bazor lives in the Vakhsh district.  He is 52 years old, married and has four children.  His son works in the Russian Federation.  Bazor is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Isaias Amaya Amaya

texts.es: Isaías de 42 años de edad tiene una tienda y una panadería, ubicada en un mismo punto en el municipio de Soledad donde lugar donde habita.  Cuando inició su vida empresarial lo hizo vendiendo frituras en diversos puntos de ventas y hace 2 años adquirió su negocio de tienda, vendiendo ranchos, víveres, abarrotes y en general artículos de la canasta familiar, poco a poco fue comprando mas activos fijos y creando su propia panadería, como  actualmente la tiene y  en la que se desempeña con mucho éxito.  En su negocio de panadería, vende de contado,  él mismo produce el pan y sus derivados y es apoyado por un empleado en las ventas que realiza en la tienda. Su meta más adelante es adquirir su propio local, para no someterse a la inestabilidad, que le  significa el encontrarse arrendado. En la actualidad planea acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar pan y productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su tienda; el éxito de esta inversión radica en que con ella,  tiene un capital de trabajo simultaneo al suyo, para hacer compras adicionales a las acostumbradas y con ello hacer una oferta interesante de productos que consumen las familias de su barrio, en unas vitrinas bien surtidas.
texts.en: Isaías is 42 years old. He has a store and a bread bakery located in the same place in the town of Soledad, where he lives. When he started his business life he did it selling fritters in different points of sale and 2 years ago he acquired his store. There he sells lunches, groceries, produce and general family basic items. Little by little he bought more active capital and created his own bread bakery where he is working with a lot of success. In his bakery  business he is paid up front and makes the bread and other products himself. He is helped by an employee with the sales in the store.  His goal for the future is to acquire his own locale so that he is not subject to instability, like he is when renting. Right now he plans to access a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy raw materials to make bread and basic gamily basket items to stock his store. The success of this investment lies in the fact that he has working capital to make additional purchases to the ones he usually makes and thus he can offer interesting products that the family's in his neighborhood consume in well stocked display cases.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread and basic family basket products to stock his store.

loans.name: Obidkhoja

texts.ru: Обидхоча житель города Исфара. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него трое детей. Он занимается изготовлением и торговлей мебели. В этой области он шесть лет. Он берет кредит для покупки досок и ДСП.
texts.en: Obidkhoja is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 37 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture.  Obidkhoja has been in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan to buy wood panels and particle boards.

loans.use: to buy wood panels and particle boards

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда жительница города Истаравшан. Она замужем. Ей 24 года. У нее трое  детей. Она занимается скотоводством. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа коровы с целью увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Umeda is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 24 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  Umeda primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она занимается животноводством. В этом ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Muhabbat lives in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 32 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  Muhabbat's husband helps her with this business.  She is requesting this loan to buy small livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Sabina es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Unidos Al Futuro” la cual está conformada por 09 integrantes dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Sabina de 54 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos independientes. Hace 10 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, este negocio empezó gracias a sus hijos y esposo, ya que fueron ellos quienes la ayudaron a emprender su  propio negocio poco a poco fue mejorando y de esta manera a llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes. Gracias a su trabajo a podido ayudar a sus hijos con su educación. El deseo de Sabina es de seguir mejorando su negocio. Con el crédito que recibió va a comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y así tener surtida su tienda. La Alcancía Comunal “Unidos Al Futuro” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso. Sabina está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la segunda del  lado izquierdo, ella viste una blusa celeste y chompa turquesa.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the “Unidos Al Futuro” (United to the Future) communal bank which has nine members dedicated to different commercial activities.  Sabina, 54, is married and has two independent children.  She’s been selling groceries for ten years, a business that started thanks to her husband and children, since they helped her start her own business that has been gradually improving so that now she has regular customers.  Thanks to her work she’s been able to help with her children’s schooling.

Sabina wants to continue improving her business.  She will use the loan she got to buy rice, sugar, noodles and milk to have her store stocked.  

The “Unidos Al Futuro” communal bank is grateful for the loan granted since it makes their progress possible.  Sabina appears in the rear, second from the left; she’s wearing a sky blue blouse and turquoise jacket.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Nazrvi

texts.ru: Назрви жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 62 года. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Она имеет средне – специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности она проработала 7 лет. На сегодняшний день Назрви занимается шитьем у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых тканей и ниток.
texts.en: Nazrvi is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  She is 62 years old, divorced and has three children.  She has a secondary-specialized education as a nurse.  She spent seven years working in her field.  Today, Nazrvi is involved in sewing at home.  She has been in this business for six years.  She is requesting this loan to buy necessary fabrics and threads.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics and threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build the church's second story.

loans.name: Tetelilla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Tetelilla está conformado por el señor Alberto va a comprar con su préstamo bolsas para regalo, peluches, postales, las señoras Antonia, Calletana  y Olga van a comprar huevo, aceite, azúcar, leche, papel higiénico, jabón, refrescos, cloro,  sopas. La señora Calletana tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 3 hijos 1 mujer y 2 hombres, solo estudia la joven en el CBTIS, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar aceite, jabón, frijol, huevo, chiles en vinagre, mayonesa, café, shampoo, fibras, pinol, suavitel, azúcar, arroz, chiles secos, guajillo, pasilla, de árbol, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años, construyo su esposo unos locales y decidió poner la tienda compro de a poquito con lo que le daba su esposo el trabajaba de albañil y fue creciendo su negocio poco a poco, su negocio es importante porque se va ayudando en algunas cosas,  a ella le gusta atender a sus clientes, ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio porque lo consiguió con su trabajo, ella esta planeando ampliar  su negocio surtir de mercancía la tienda para darle mejor servicio al cliente. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que su negocio crezca, que sus hijos estén bien tengan trabajo y una vida tranquila. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por el apoyo que nos brindan, gracias a sus préstamos vamos avanzando en los negocios y en las familias”.
texts.en: This communal bank is called Tetelilla. Alberto is a member. With his loan he is going to buy gift bags, stuffed animals, and postcards. Antonia, Calletana  and Olga are going to buy eggs, oil, milk, toilet paper, soap, beverages, bleach and soups. Calletana is 47 years old. She is married and has 3 children, 1 girl and 2 boys. Only the girl goes to school, at CBTIS. She has a small grocery store and asked for the loan to buy oil, beans, chiles in vinegar, mayonnaise, coffee, shampoo, cloths, pine cleaner, sugar, rice, dried chiles, guajillo chiles, pasilla chiles, and tree chiles. She started her business 15 years ago. Her husband built some locales and she decided to open the store. She bought a little with what her husband gave her from his work as a bricklayer and she grew her business little by little. Her business is important because it helps her with a lot of things. She likes to serve her customers and she is proud of her business because she built it with her hard work. She is planning on growing her business and giving her customers better service, Her hopes and reams are for her business to grow and for her children to be well and to have jobs and a calm life. The members of the group want to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad “thank you for the support you have given us. Thanks to your loans, we are progressing in our businesses and in our families”.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, beans, eggs, sugar, mayonnaise, coffee, shampoo, dried guajillo chiles, pasilla chiles, tree chiles, etc.

loans.name: Tatiana Africano Garcia

texts.es: Tatiana ha vivido siempre entre maquinas, telas, hilos y  tijeras, desde muy pequeña, pues sus padres tenían talleres de confecciones y llegaron a contratar mas de 50 empleados. Por eso cuando ella tuvo uso de razón y conformó su familia, a sus 17 años, se dedicó a un arte que lleva casi que en sus genes. Así fue como aprovechando que su cónyuge la apoyó para iniciarlo  y que este trabajaba en una clínica, donde consiguieron contratos para realizar trabajos en ropa quirúrgica, con las que le fue muy bien. Pero posteriormente después de la separación de su esposo, suspendió su negocio, pero una vez recuperada, lo inició nuevamente como hasta la presente lo tiene. Ella cuenta con activos fijos apropiados a su capacidad productiva, sus clientes están ubicados en las ciudades de Cartagena  y Montería y en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde presta el servicio de maquila para una surtidora de confecciones. En la actualidad vive acompañada de sus padres y de su hijo menor, con quien sueña ver convertido en un hombre exitoso y  en un magnifico ser humano.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas e insumos, como hilos broches, cierres, elásticos, y pedrería para procesar sus prendas. Su mayor desafió es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para atender los pedidos y esto es justamente lo que logrará con su credikiva, lo que convertirá esta inversión en exitosa.
texts.en:
Tatiana has always lived among machines, fabric, thread and scissors since she was a little girl because her parents had clothes making shops and at one time had more than 50 employees.  Because of this, when she became an adult and formed her own family at the age of 17 she dedicated herself to this art that she carries in her genes.  She took advantage of the fact that her spouse supported her in order to start out and that he worked in a clinic and they were able to get contracts from it to make surgical apparel that they did very well with.  

Later, after she separated from her husband, she suspended work but once she recuperated, she started it up again and has it to date.  She owns fixed assets appropriate to her productive capacity.  Her customers are located in the cities of Cartagena, Montería and in the city of Barranquilla where she provides assembly services for a confections supplier.  She currently lives with her parents and her minor son who she dreams with seeing becoming a successful man and a magnificent human being.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy fabric and supplies like thread, clasps, zippers, elastic and beading to make her apparel.  Her greatest challenge is having enough working capital to fill her orders and this is precisely what she will accomplish with her Kiva loan which will make this investment successful.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad, que estudia y trabaja. Cursa el cuarto semestre en la especialidad técnica de Administración Bancaria hace dos  años. Él decidió estudiar dicha carrera, ya que le  pareció una carrera interesante e importante; tuvo el apoyo de sus padres para asumir algunos costos de su carrera. Para Carlos es importante que una persona se esté capacitándose constantemente, pues a futuro le permitirá  tener oportunidades de mejores puestos de trabajo. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa reconocida, la cual le  brinda facilidades de tiempo para que  pueda seguir estudiando. Terminar su carrera satisfactoriamente es una de  sus metas, pues al finalizar,  piensa seguir la carrera profesional de ingeniería económica. El crédito que solicito lo utilizara para  pagar la matrícula del quinto semestre además de sus pensiones.
texts.en: Carlos, 22, is a young man who works and studies.  He’s been studying for two years and is in the fourth semester of Banking Administration.  He decided to study this career because he believe it was an interesting and an important career.  He had his parents’ support who took on some of the costs of the career.  For Carlos it’s important that a person be constantly actualizing himself because in the future that can bring opportunities for better employment.  He currently works for a well-known firm which allows him time to continue attending classes.  One of his goals is to satisfactorily finish his career because once he does so he plans to follow the career of Economic Engineering.  The loan he requested will be used to pay tuition for fifth semester and also to pay for his meals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and meals.

loans.name: Juan Cesar

texts.es: Juan es un joven estudiante de 19 años de edad, y  cursa el tercer ciclo de la carrera de mantenimiento de máquinas de planta en un instituto de prestigio. Eligio esta carrera pues le pareció interesante,  en el trascurso del tiempo le fue gustando aún mas, tal lo demuestran sus notas, pues es uno de los primeros en su clase. Sus padres son quienes le  apoyan en su educación. Ser un egresado profesional competitivo es su mayor sueño, pues al culminar sus estudios buscara  trabajo en una  reconocida empresa, es  por ello que se  esfuerza mucho. El agradece a sus padres por confiar en él y brindarles su apoyo.  El crédito que solicito lo invertirá para sus pagos de pensiones. Juan está agradecido con el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Juan, 19, is a young student in third semester of machine repair at a prestigious institute.  He chose this career because it seemed interesting and as time went by he got to like it even more, so much so that his grades reflect this, since he’s one of the first in his class.  His parents support his education.  His greatest dream is to graduate as a successful, competitive professional because upon graduation he will seek employment with a well-known firm and this is why he strives so much.  He is grateful to his parents for trusting him and offering support.  The loan he’s asked for is to pay for meals.  Juan is grateful for the loan provided.

loans.use: to pay for his meals.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Futuro Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Mujeres con Futuro, está conformado por las señoras Nelva Griselda, Maricela, Edith, Aleida, Celia ellas van a comprar con su préstamo harina, pintura, aceite, bolsa, diurex, la señora Florencia Martha va a comprar oblea, bolsa, diurex y estuches, la señora Crispina Martina va a comprar pollo. La señora Florencia Martha tiene 37 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre, ella tiene 3 hijas que están estudiando 2 en la secundaria y la pequeña en la primaria, ella vende obleas las hace en figuras, con miel y pepita y con estuche redondo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar materia prima obleas, miel, pepita, aceite vegetal, bolsa, diurex, una parte para reparar su camioneta y otra para pagar a peones, ella inicio su negocio hace 14 años fue comprando la maquinaria en pagos, su negocio es importante porque es un ingreso para la familia y puede darle empleo a varias personas, ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio gracia a él tiene todo la necesario  sus hijas, ella sale a la feria a vender y ya tiene ingresos, ella utiliza las ganancia para los gastos de la escuela de su hijas, para la alimentación y para pagar el préstamo, sus hijas le ayudan a combinar las obleas, su esposo hace los estuches. Sus sueños y esperanzas que crezca el negocio y que sus hijas continúen en sus estudios y alcancen una carrera. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, nos ayudan a arreglar algunos problemas que tenemos y que sigan ayudando a las personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Mujeres con Futuro” (Women with a Future).  Its members are Nelva Griselda, Maricela, Edith, Aleida and Celia who will use the loan to buy flour, paint, oil, bags, and cellophane tape.  Florencia Martha will buy wafers, bags, cellophane tape and containers.  Crispina Martina will buy chicken. 

Florencia Martha, 37, has a spouse and three daughters attending school, two in secondary school and the little one in elementary school.  She sells 'obleas' [thin wafer sandwiches filled with caramel] that she makes in different shapes with honey and pumpkin seeds that she sells in round containers.  She asked for the loan to buy raw materials: wafers, honey, pumpkin seeds, vegetable oil, bags and cellophane tape.  Part of it will be used to repair her truck and another to pay laborers.  She started the business 14 years ago.  She paid for the machinery in installments.  Her business is important because it’s an income for the family and she can give employment to several people.  She feels proud of her business for thanks to it her daughters have everything they need.  She goes out to the street market to sell and earns income.  She uses profits for all of her daughters’ school expenses, for food and to repay the loan.  Her daughters help her assemble the ‘obleas’  and her husband makes the containers.  Her dreams and hopes are that the business grows and that her daughters continue with their schooling and attain careers.  

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for your loans; they help us fix some problems we have.  Please continue helping people in need.”

loans.use: to buy wafers, honey, pumpkin seeds, vegetable oil, bags and cellophane tape.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
47-year-old Cornelio is a married man from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has five children, whose ages are between 15 and 25.

Cornelio has been working as a fisherman for 20 years. He earns about 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from his fishing business. Cornelio is working hard to improve his income and sustain his family. His goal is to have all his children finish college and provide a bright future for them.

Cornelio has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and salt. This will contribute to Cornelio's business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and salt.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 57, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Willy, a contractor, and a father to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
   
Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi, tiene 61 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales solo vive con 1, tiene mas de 5 años como socia, es casada, tiene su pastelería, gracias a Finca Perú que le ayuda económicamente en su hogar, está ahorrando para comprar más cosa para su negocio, gracias a los ahorros pudo educar a sus hijos, se ha logrado comprar máquinas para la elaboración de tortas, con elprñestamo que solicita  comprará insumos como azúcar, harina, mantequilla y otros.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the communal bank Yachay Wasi.  She is 61, married and the mother of six children, one of whom still lives at home.  She runs a bakery and for over five years has been a member of the communal bank.  Thanks to Finca Perú, which helps her handle her household economy, she is saving to buy more goods for her business.
