At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                        
     
Emma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emma hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Paul Muchai

texts.en: Paul is a 33-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. He describes himself to be an optimistic man. He operates a retail store where he sells items made of metal, such as windows, doors, etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a potential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more metal items for selling. Paul's dream and goal is to run several similar retail stores within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy metal items.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna earns a living by selling peanut rolls to her community. She has had this business for 4 years. She earns about 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. Jinna works hard to support her childrens' studies.

Jinna is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, and syrup. She hopes for her business to grow. She plans to purchase a vehicle to help with the delivery of her products.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, and syrup.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María, vive con su hija, atienden una pupuseria de la cual se mantienen las dos, esta venta es por las tardes, ella atiende los oficios domésticos y prepara la venta para iniciar por la tarde a atender a la clientela. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para la elaboración de las pupusas, como aceite, condimentos, quesillo, chicharrón, aderezos, gaseosas,  con esta compra lograra mantener surtida la pupuseria, teniendo lo necesario para realizar la venta.
La aspiración de María es crecer en el negocio, tener la oportunidad de mejorar la condición familiar y poder trabajar con el préstamo de una forma responsable.
texts.en:
María lives with her daughter, and they run a "pupuseria" (pupusas are a traditional Salvadoran food made of a thick corn tortilla that is stuffed with a combination of cheese, meat and beans) and this is how they support themselves. They sell in the afternoons. She attends to her household chores, and prepares what they will sell, so that they can start serving customers in the afternoon.  

She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for making the pupusas, such as cooking oil, condiments, soft cheese, roast pork, dressings, as well as soft drinks. 

With this purchase, she will manage to keep the pupuseria supplied, and have what she needs to carry out her business.

María's ambition is to see her business grow, have the chance to improve her family's situation, and be able to work responsibly with the loan.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, condiments, soft cheese, roast pork, dressings, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Adelina de 60 años de edad, es viuda, madre de 3 hijas mayores de edad, y abuela de 4 nietas hermosas
La Sra. Adelina, cuenta con un salón comercial que en la actualidad se encuentra alquilado y también cuenta  con un pequeño comercio en la cual se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas. Comenta que hace esto hace más de 10 años lo que le da un buen ingreso que le ayuda a vivir dignamente  Desea ver a sus nietos convertirse en profesionales y que sean útil para la sociedad y para consigas mismos.
La Sra. Adelina a pesar de su edad es una señora muy sacrificada y por sobre todo muy trabajadora y anhela seguir trabajando para sentirse útil.
Solicita el crédito para poder refaccionar el salón que alquila, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo un buen salón a los clientes que quieran alquilarlo.
texts.en:
Señora Adelina is 60 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three adult daughters and the grandmother of four beautiful granddaughters.

Señora Adelina has a commercial space that is now rented, and she also has a little business in which she sells used clothing. She comments that she has been doing this for more than 10 years, and it gives her a good income, which helps her to live with dignity. She wants to see her grandchildren become professionals who are useful to society and to themselves.

Señora Adelina, in spite of her age, is a very sacrificing woman and above all very hardworking. She wants to continue working so that she can feel useful. She is applying for the loan to be able to remodel the commercial space that she rents and in this way continue to offer a good space to the customers who want to rent it.

loans.use: to renovate the commercial space that she rents out

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
This is Leonida, 57, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio, a seaman, and is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                        
    
Leonida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leonida hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman.  She has three children that range in age from three to 15 years.  She describes herself to be ambitious woman.  

She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables including onions, tomatoes, maize, bananas, etc.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs two staff members.  Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems.  She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruits and vegetables. 

Her business goal is to run several similar outlets within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Showers Of Grace Group

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Fadzayi from Harare the capital of Zimbabwe.  She is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. 

Fadzayi runs a retail business, selling groceries.  The business has been in operation for 12 years.  She says the main challenge she faces is stiff competition.  Fadzayi has requested a loan of $750 to buy groceries for resale.  She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s welfare.  

In the future Fadzayi plans to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz de 25 años vive al sur de la ciudad donde  se dedica al diseño y comercialización de calzado y bolsos, al por mayor y al detal. Su negocio está ubicada   en su propio apartamento; en su taller ella compra los materiales como caucho, fique, microsuit, plantilla deportiva No.9, tela para empaques, diseña los zapatos y se los lleva a un zapatero, quien los termina de confeccionar. Una vez fabricados, los empaca y los entrega a sus clientes. También elabora bolsos, en menor medida. Sus ventas son de contado y también trabaja la modalidad de credicontado. Sus clientes los consigue por Internet, en el Facebook, en ferias, repartiendo volantes y tarjetas de presentación.  También le vende a dos almacenes en Santa marta. La competencia es baja, y la enfrenta con calidad, cumplimiento de pedidos y satisfacción integral de sus clientes. Realmente, los zapatos son muy lindos y originales, con estampados ecológicos, y genera dos empleos directos ella y el zapatero, y dos indirectos  que son los dos vendedores que tiene en la ciudad de Santa Marta.
Cuenta con excelentes estados financieros. La cartera que aparece es pequeña, porque prácticamente vende de contado. Presenta infraestructura física adecuada para este tipo de negocios y sus estados financieros reflejan una situación económica estable y solvente. Como cada día sus clientela crece, el capital de trabajo ara hacer las compras es u gran desafío, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,    dirigido a  capital de trabajo, con el fin de mantener un fondo en efectivo para comprar las materias primas necesarias en la elaboración de los zapatos y los bolsos, al por mayor y de contado. También desea registrar su marca ante las entidades gubernamentales respectivas y esta es una de sus metas
texts.en:
Beatriz is 25 years old and lives south of the city, where she makes a living designing and selling shoes and handbags; she sells them both wholesale and retail.  Her business is based out of her apartment.  She purchases materials for her business such as rubber, fique fiber, micro suit fabric, insoles, and packing material.  She designs the shoes and then takes the materials to a cobbler who makes the shoes for her.  Once the shoes are finished Beatriz packs them up and delivers them to her customers.  She also makes handbags, though that is a smaller part of her business.  She sells her items for cash and for credit.  Beatriz gets new customers through the Internet, on Facebook, in street markets, and by handing out fliers and business cards.  She also sells to two stores in Santa Marta.  The competition is low, and she meets the competition with the quality of her products, her success in fulfilling orders, and the overall satisfaction of her customers.  Her shoes are very beautiful and original with ecological patterns.  Her business has directly created two jobs—hers and the cobbler’s—and contributes to the business of the two vendors who sell her products in the city of Santa Marta.         

Beatriz has an excellent financial record.  Her business is small, since she sells most of her products for cash.  Her infrastructure is adequate for this type of business, and her financial record reflects an economic situation that is both stable and solvent.  However, as Beatriz’s clientele expands, her biggest challenge is having enough working capital to purchase materials for her business.  That is why she has decided to take out a loan.  This is Beatriz’s first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it for working capital.  She will use it to maintain a cash fund for purchasing the materials she needs to produce shoes and handbags, which she will sell wholesale and retail.  Beatriz also wants to register her brand with the relevant government agencies, since that has been one of her goals.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, a married mother of five children, four of whom are in school, lives in Kampala, Uganda where she resides in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.

For the past eight years Rehema has had a business selling bananas. Working seven days a week, she sells her products at the market, and also generates income through a rental house. Her main business challenges include transportation and thieves. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Rehema has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas (plantains). Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Asociación El Comején Group

texts.es: La Asociación para el Desarrollo de la Comarca El Comején No. 2 (ASODESCCOM), es una asociación civil sin fines de lucro fundada en Agosto del 2007 que atiende a 493 usuarios de servicio de agua comunitario, siendo alrededor de 5,830 habitantes abastecidos. Uno de los principales objetivos de la asociación es la creación, promoción y desarrollo de programas de producción alternativos de abastecimiento de agua potable que garanticen la seguridad alimenticia y el acceso al agua potable de la comunidad. De total de usuarios el 20% no tienen micro medidores de agua, es por ello que están solicitando financiamiento para la compra de micro medidores. Con la inversión se llevará un mejor control y uso del agua por parte de los usuarios, pues se facturara lo que realmente consumen.
texts.en: The Asociación para el Desarrollo de la Comarca El Comején No. 2 [Association for the Development of the Comején Region No. 2] (ASODESCCOM) is a non-profit organization that was founded in August 2007 to provide community water services to 493 users.  It now supplies water to around 5,830 residents.  One of the main objectives of the association is to create, promote, and develop programs for producing alternative water supplies, which would guarantee water security and access to potable water for the community.  At present 20% of users do not have water meters, and so the group is asking for funding so they can purchase water meters.  This investment will allow community members to take better control of their water use and will ensure that they are billed for the amount of water that they actually consume.

loans.use: to purchase water meters for their community water system.

loans.name: Patricia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 31 años, se describe como una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia. Patricia vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Ibarra que pertenece a la Provincia de Imbabura.

Patricia tiene una tienda de víveres en la cual ella trabaja sola, este negocio ayuda a solventar algunos gastos de su hogar y para el estudio de uno de sus hijos. Patricia trabaja con Fodemi cerca de ocho años, el actual crédito que realiza es para la compra de pañales para bebés, refrescos y productos de primera necesidad, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así obtener buenos ingresos económicos.

Patricia sueña con tener un local propio para su tienda y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 31-year-old woman and describes herself as enterprising, hard-working, and very dedicated to her family.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in Ibarra, which is in the province of Imbabura.

Patricia has a general store where she works alone.  This business helps with some of their home's expenses and the educational costs of one of their children.  She has worked with Fodemi for almost 8 years.  Her current loan will be used to buy diapers, soft drinks, and basic goods to offer her customers better service so she can obtain a better income.

Patricia dreams about having her own location for her store and to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business with diapers, soft drinks, and basic goods.

loans.name: Sedjlogande Group

texts.fr: SEDJLOGANDE est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans la même localité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Ikoucoléto Elisabeth (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Ikoucoléto Elisabeth est mariée à un certain Casmir et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Ikoucoléto Elisabeth vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges familiales.  Ikoucoléto Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Ikoucoléto Elisabeth mène comme activité la vente de bois de chauffage, de pain et de boisson locale dans son quartier depuis près de huit ans. Ikoucoléto Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Ikoucoléto Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe SEDJLOGANDE un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SEDJLOGANDE is a group made up of four people who live in the same locality.  

The representative of the group, Ikoucoléto Elisabeth (raising her hand in the photo) is 37 years old.  She is married to a man named Casmir and has two children who both attend school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses with her husband.  

Ikoucoléto Elisabeth never attended school.  In order to cover her various expenses, she has been selling firewood, bread and a local drink in her neighborhood for about 8 years.  She stocks up in one of the regions of Benin.

In order to better meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, and also to increase her profits, Ikoucoléto Elisabeth is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the SEDJLOGANDE group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy firewood, containers of local drink and bread.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary de 34 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 5 y 10 años. Mary genera ingresos a partir de un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancías variadas, las cuales promociona mediante guidas especializadas de productos y compra de contado y a crédito, porque su recuperación no le alcanza para hacerlo con el dinero en la mano, debido a que sus ventas son a créditos y en plazos ajustados a las necesidades de su clientela. Su meta es terminar de  adecuar su vivienda y por eso trabaja incansablemente en su propio negocio y también en otras tareas con las que apoya a otras  familias, en el desempeño de sus actividades domésticas. Su idea de negocio inició para apoyar el sustento de su hogar, antes solamente en manos de su cónyuge. Mary está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará productos de belleza, ropa interior, perfume y mercancía por encargo. El Mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para responder a su demanda y comprar de contado y con Kiva lo logrará, este es justamente el fundamento de su éxito en esta inversión..
texts.en:
Mary, 34, lives in Soledad, 20 minutes from Barranquilla, with her partner and their two children, 5 and 10 years old.  Mary generates an income from a business in which she sells assorted merchandise, which she promotes through specialized catalogs and she buys the products with cash and on credit.  What she makes on the sales does not allow her to pay with money that she has on hand.  This is because she makes the sales to her customers on credit with adjustable terms depending on what they can pay.  Her goal is to finish fixing up her house and that is why she works tirelessly in her own business.  She also does household chores to help other family members.  She started the business to support her household; previously only her partner covered the expenses.  
Mary is applying to CrediKiva, the first loan that she requests from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will use it to buy beauty products, lingerie, perfume, and merchandise on request.  Her biggest challenge is to have enough working capital to fill the orders and to be able to buy with cash.  Kiva will help her succeed with the investment.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, lingerie, perfume and merchansdise that has been requested

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama girasol y se integra de tres señora quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva a actividad y viven en una comunidad pequeña llamada Ángel albino  corzo.

    Quien  se le  tomo  la entrevista se llama Sahira ella es casada con el señor sauce con quien a su responsabilidad tiene a dos hijas  que  estudian en la universidad, ella solicito  el  préstamo para invertirlo  en la compra  de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos  suaves en donde lleva trabajando seis meses y la va bien.

   Inicio con esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y así  darle lo más necesario  a su familia y juntos salgan adelante.

    Lo  que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  ella pueda seguir trabajando y con el préstamo  apoyarse para obtener más ingresos y mejorar un poco más su taquería.
   
        Quienes integran en el grupo son: Magdai quien invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio  de abarrotes y la señora Rosa Lidia  invertirá en sus abarrotes y su estética.
texts.en:
This group is called "Girasol" [Sunflower] and is made up of three women, each of whom makes a living through her own business.  They live in a small community called Ángel Albino Corzo.

Sahira was the group member who was interviewed.  She is married to Sauce, with whom she has two daughters who are in college.  She requested the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make soft tacos.  She has had this business for six months, and it is going well for her.  She started the business to help her husband with their income, to give their family what they need most, and to get ahead together.

What she wants the most with her business is to be able to keep working and to obtain more income with the loan and to improve her taco business a little more.

The other members of the group are Magdai, who will invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store, and Rosa Lidia, who will invest in groceries and her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tacos.

loans.name: Maria Gisela

texts.es:
María, vive con su abuela y su hija de 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a administrar la tienda de productos domésticos, tiene tres años de tenerlo, trabaja de lunes a domingo, cuenta con el apoyo de su abuela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, gaseosas, jugos, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar el inventario y aumentar las ventas.
La aspiración de María es tener un negocio más grande, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, apoyándola en el estudio.
texts.en: María lives with her grandmother and 7-year-old daughter.  She has had a business selling products for the home for 3 years.  She works Monday through Sunday and has the help of her grandmother.  She is requesting a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, and juices.  This purchase will help her increase her inventory and sales.  Her dream is to have a bigger business and to offer her daughter a better quality of life by supporting her education.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Yelian Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YELIAN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marcelline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marcelline est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Athanase. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marcelline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Marcelline vend depuis quatorze ans du charbon de bois et de façon secondaire de l’akassa faite à base du maïs dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Marcelline s’approvisionne dans une région du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marcelline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YELIAN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The YELIAN group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the third time to bolster their activities. The group’s representative is Marcelline, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Marcelline is 52 years old and married to a man named Athanase. The couple have four dependent children who all go to school. Marcelline lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To help provide for the family’s needs, Marcelline started selling charcoal and maize-based akassa (porridge) in her neighborhood fourteen years ago, and this allows her to support herself easily. She buys her merchandise in a region of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Marcelline is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group YELIAN. The two previous loans were repaid without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Apci1 Group

texts.fr: APCI1 est un groupe composé de neuf personnes, et dont les membres appartiennent à un même collectif des artisans d'une commune. Le représentant du groupe, Adéoniran Abdel (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 34 ans. Adéoniran Abdel est marié à une marchande du nom de Ossénantou. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants et certains sont scolarisés. Adéoniran Abdel vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Adéoniran Abdel a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire et a appris la coiffure. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Adéoniran Abdel mène cette activité depuis près de quinze ans dans sa région. Adéoniran Abdel achète ses produits de coiffure au Nigeria. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, Adéoniran Abdel sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe APCI1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The APCI1 group consists of nine people.  All members of the group belong to the same local artisan association.  

The group's representative, Adéoniran Abdel (raising his hand in the photo) is 34 years old.  He is married to a retailer named Ossénantou.  The couple has six children in their care, four of whom are their own children.  Some of the children attend school.  Adéoniran Abdel lives with his wife and children, and takes care of the various household expenses with his wife.

Adéoniran Abdel left school at the primary level and learned the trade of hairdressing.  In order to cover his various expenses, he has been working as a hairdresser in his region for almost 15 years.  He buys his hair styling products in Nigeria.

In order to expand his business and to become more competitive on the market, he is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the APCI1 group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair styling products.

loans.name: Nouhoumon Pierre

texts.fr: Nouhoumon Pierre est âgé de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Nouhoumon Pierre est marié à Christiane. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Nouhoumon Pierre  vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Nouhoumon Pierre mène comme activité la soudure. De façon secondaire, Nouhoumon Pierre vend de maïs dans sa région. Nouhoumon Pierre exerce cette activité passionnément depuis près de vingt ans. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Nouhoumon Pierre contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Nouhoumon Pierre s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Nouhoumon Pierre sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Nouhoumon Pierre ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Nouhoumon Pierre is 42, lives in Benin, and is married to Christiane. The couple has four children under their supervision - three of which are their own, and all of which go to school. Nouhoumon Pierre lives with his wife and children, and he and his wife take care of the household expenses.

To meet his needs and those of his children, Nouhoumon Pierre is a welder. As a second job, Nouhoumon Pierre sells corn in the region. Nouhoumon Pierre has been doing this job passionately for nearly twenty years. Thanks to the revenue that this job brings in, Nouhoumon Pierre can help with his family's various expenses.

Nouhoumon Pierre buys his supplies in a region of Benin. To satisfy his clients' growing needs, Nouhoumon Pierre is asking for his third loan from Alidé. His previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and pipes for welding and sacs of corn.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa se ha destacado por ser una persona trabajadora elaborando sus riquísimas tortillas inicia sus labores en dos turnos de 10:00 am a 12:00 pm y de 4:00 pm a 6:00 pm. Además de vender sus riquísimas tortillas vende nacatamales todos los días viernes

La señora María Luisa utilizará el crédito de CEPRODEL para la compra al por mayor de los productos con los cuales elabora las  Tortillas donde obtiene mayor ganancia y así ha podido mejorar su poco a poco su vivienda. Entre los productos que comprará se encuentran Maíz, Leña, Cal.

La señora se siente muy agradecida con los créditos brindado por CEPRODEL los cuales han sido una bendición logrando mejoras en su vivienda y la calidad de  vida de ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa stands out as a hardworking person who makes delicious tortillas. She works in two shifts, from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. and from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m. In addition to tortillas she sells “nacatamales” every Friday.

Maria Luisa will use the loan from CEPRODEL to buy wholesale ingredients for her tortillas. This is where she earns most of her profit, which has enabled her to make home improvements, little by little.  Among the products she will buy are corn, firewood and lime.

She is very grateful for the loans provided by CEPRODEL, which have been a blessing in improving her home and her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn and lime.

loans.name: Marcos Raul Rendon Suarez

texts.es:
Marcos Paúl tiene 57 años de edad es divorciado no tiene hijos, vive en un casa arrendada solo en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Marcos se dedica a realizar carreras en un taxi todos los días. Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador y muebles para la sala.

Las compras la realizará en ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar una casa. 

El desafío al que se enfrenta es en las carreteras y la delincuencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Marcos Raúl, 57, is divorced and doesn't have any children. He lives alone in a rented home in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Marcos works every day as a taxi driver. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a computer and furniture for his living room. He will make the purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to be able to buy a home. 

Challenges that he faces include the highways and petty crime. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy a computer and furniture for the living room.

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario Téllez García

texts.es:
La señora Ramona del Rosario, originaria de la ciudad de león, madre soltera de 2 hijos, su negocio es producto de una herencia de parte de su abuelita, inicia con un capital de trabajo con C$ 3,000.00 córdobas.
Realiza las compras de productos en el mercado la terminal posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de trabajo ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad de león.
La señora Ramona utilizará el crédito que le ha brindado CEPRODEL para la compra al por mayor de los productos tales como son: Especias de todo tipo tales como: Achote, mostaza, chilla, vino dulce, salsa de tomate, frutas y verduras de todo tipo, etc.

La señora Ramona del Rosario está sumamente agradecida con CEPRODEL por los créditos brindados hacia su persona los cuales han sido una bendición muy grande, con ellos ha podido sacar a sus hijos adelante mejorando la calidad de vida de toda su familia y de ella.
texts.en:
Ramona del Rosario, a native of Leon, is a single mother with two children. Her business is the result of an inheritance from her grandmother. She started with about C$3,000 cordobas.

She buys products in the La Terminal market and later moves them to her stall in the Central Market in Leon. She will use the loan from CEPRODEL to buy products in bulk like: spices of all kinds, including annatto, mustard and chia; cooking wine; tomato sauce, fruits and vegetables, etc.

Romona del Rosario is incredibly grateful to CEPRODEL for the loans they have given her, which have been a great blessing. With them she has been able to help her kids get ahead and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spices like annatto, mustard, and chia, cooking wine, tomato sauce, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Armine Khndzrtsyan

texts.en: Armine is from the village of Azatan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with two children: a thirteen-year-old daughter and a nine-year-old son.  Armine has a high school education and has been farming for twenty years. She also helps her relatives in the city with produce grown on her farm. Armine is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She expects this investment to increase the family's income by twenty percent. She dreams of having both her children attend university.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with five children: three daughters (aged ten, twelve and fourteen) and two sons (aged twenty and twenty-one). She has a high school education and has been tending the family farm for fourteen years. Marine considers herself a kind and hardworking person. She dreams of her daughters receiving a university education. 

Marine would like a loan to purchase calves and feed. According to her plan, this investment will increase the family's income by eighteen percent. Marine is a conservative businessperson, and her equity in the business is five times more than her debt.

loans.use: to purchase calves and feed.

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia del Valle que es conocida también como “San Bautista de El Valle” que se encuentra  situada al sureste de Cuenca, parroquia que tiene atractivos como la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras), su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Rosa tiene 50 año, es divorciada y en  su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 25, 24, 22 y 20 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene un local donde vende confites como galletas, chocolates, caramelos, chupetes, etc. labora de domingo a domingo las 24 horas del día para lo cual hace turnos con una de sus hijas. En su casa se dedica a la cría de borregos y pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de toda clase de dulces para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Mujeres Floreciendo" ("Women in Bloom") communal bank. She lives in the del Valle parish, also known as San Bautista del Valle, located in the southeast of Cuenca. The parish has attractions such as the Cochapamba lagoon (filled with cattail) and the inhabitants work in retail, livestock and agriculture. They preserve the people's culture and traditions.
Rosa is 50 years old and divorced. From her marriage she conceived four children aged 25, 24, 22 and 20. Her three oldest children work and help her financially, and the youngest son attends one of the town's high schools. She doesn't have her own home, which is why she lives in her mother's house and they split the home expenses.
Rosa owns a store where she sells sweets such as cookies, chocolate, candy, lollipops, etc. She works 24 hours a day from Sunday to Sunday, and in order to do that, she and one of her daughters take turns. At home she raises sheep and chickens.
She has been a member of the communal bank for three years. She will use the loan to purchase all kinds of sweets for her business.
Her dream is to own a home of her own.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of sweets.

loans.name: Mariam Khachatryan

texts.en:
Mariam is from the village of Erazgavors in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with three children: a twenty-eight-year-old daughter and two sons (aged twenty-five and twenty-seven). She is known to be an honest person and has been working hard on the family farm for thirty years. She wants to save enough money to help her children buy homes. 

Mariam is looking for a loan to purchase cows. This investment in her business should increase the family's income by twenty-five percent. She is pleased with the services of microfinance. Mariam is proud to have her own farming business.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La Sra. Elvira de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, es de la ciudad de Itá. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida donde atiende a la mayor parte de sus vecinos y amigos ofreciéndoles los mejores productos, a buen precio y variedad.
Ella nos dice que siempre trabaja el doble para poder darles a sus hijos todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Su sacrificio es porque quiere ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas de bien, útiles no solo a sí mismas sino también a la sociedad.
Elvira solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, leche, yerba, fideos, arroz, azúcar y demás artículos, con los cuales podrá abastecer su despensa y tenerla bien surtida para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes buena variedad. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo ella y sus hijos, ya que se encuentra sola y la ayuda le será muy de provecho.
texts.en:
45-year-old Elvira is a single mother of two children from the town of Itá. She owns a well-stocked grocery store where she serves most of her neighbors and friends by offering them a good variety of the best products at good prices.
She tells us that she works twice as hard so that she can provide her children with everything they need for living with dignity and without the deprivation she had to go through. She sacrifices herself because she wishes to see her children become well-adjusted people who are useful not only to themselves but to society as well.
Elvira requests the loan in order to purchase flour, milk, maté, noodles, rice, sugar and other items. This will allow her to stock up her store and keep it well assorted so that she can continue to offer her customers a wide variety of merchandise. She gives thanks to the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity she and her children are getting, since she's by herself and she will very much benefit from this help.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, maté, noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Berta De Jesus

texts.es:
Berta, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo, alquilan vivienda, se dedica a la pupuseria, tiene un año en el negocio, este lo ha iniciado por iniciativa propia y con la ayuda del esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para mejorar el negocio, comprara, maíz, aceite, condimentos, gaseosas, jugos, con ello espera satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y aumentar las ventas.
La aspiración de Berta es crecer más en el negocio, mejorar su condición y estabilizarse con su esposo.
texts.en:
Berta, who is 25 years old, lives with her husband in a rented home. She has a pupusa (corn tortillas with fillings, a typical Salvadoran dish) stand. She has had this business for a year. She began it on her own initiative and with the help of her husband.

She is applying for a loan to purchase the materials to improve her business. She will buy corn, oil, condiments, soft drinks, and juices. With this she hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers and increase her sales.

Berta's goal is to grow more in her business, improve her condition, and stabilize herself with her husband.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.name: Las Floresitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  las Florecitas que se  integra  de tres señoras quien cada una tiene su actividad y viven en una localidad llamada  llano grande.

   Quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama  Francisca quien es  soltera y vive con sus padres.

    Solito el  préstamo  para invertirlo en  la compra de zapato y sandalias en donde lleva trabajando   ocho meses  y le está dando  un buen resultado.

    Inicio con esta actividad para apoyarse con los ingresos y así no verse limitada  con algunas cosas que desea comprar para su hogar.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguirá delante para apoyar a sus papas con sus ingresos.

    Las persona que integran en su grupo son: Gloria, quien invertirá en la compra de pollo de granja para venderlo asado y la señora Adelaida invertirá en la comercialización de ganado.
texts.en:
The group named Las Florecitas is made up of three women who have their own jobs and live in a town called Llano Grande.  The one who was interviewed is named Francisca.  She is single and lives with her parents.

She requested the loan to invest in buying shoes and sandals.  She has been working for eight months and she is getting good results.

She began this work to support herself with the income and so not be limited with some things she wants to buy for her home.  What she wants with this little job is to be able to continue getting ahead to help her parents with her income.

The people who make up the group are Gloria, who will invest in buying poultry to sell grilled, and Adelaida, who will invest in selling cattle.

loans.use: to pay for buying and selling footwear.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Salomón, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 5 años de estar en el negocio, lo inicio junto a su esposa, ha ganado muchos clientes y experiencia, permitiéndole tener esta fuente de ingresos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, que le ayude a mejorar los ingresos por medio de las ventas y así también mantener un nivel estable de ganancias para la familia.
La aspiración de Salomón esta en estabilizarse con el negocio, apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio universitario para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Salomón lives with his wife and two children. He has sold clothing for about 5 years, started the business with his wife and has gained many customers and experience that allows him to have a source of income. He needs the loan to buy clothing like: blouses, skirts, and underwear that will help him improve his earnings through his sales as well as having a steady income for his family.

Salomón wishes to have a steady business and to support his children in their university education so that they can get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy clothing like, blouses, skirts, and underwear

loans.name: Aida Hovhannisyan

texts.en:
Aida is from the village of Erazgavors in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with three children: a twenty-two-year-old daughter and two sons (aged twenty-four and twenty-eight). Aida is a respected person in the village of Erazgavors, having worked on the family farm for the past twenty years. 

She is looking for a loan to purchase calves and feed. According to Aida’s business plan this investment will increase the family's income by thirty-five percent. She keeps her debts low, and the equity in her business is four times more than her loans. Aida enjoys living in Erazgavors, surrounded by family and friends.

loans.use: to purchase calves and feed.

loans.name: Peprone

texts.en:
Peprone is from the village of Lusaghbyur in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with a five-year-old daughter. Peprone has a high school education and has been farming for the past five years. The extra income helps pay for the medical treatments of her daughter who is disabled. 

Peprone is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and seeds. She expects that this investment will increase her income by twenty percent. Peprone dreams of one day buying a house for her family. She has a positive opinion of microfinance and looks forward to growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds.

loans.name: Tamara Aghajanyan

texts.en:
Tamara is from the village of Lusaghbyur in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with four children: three daughters (aged seven, ten and twelve) and a five-year-old son. Tamara has a high school education and has been farming for the past fifteen years. She considers herself a hardworking, honest person. She manages her finances well. Tamara keeps her debt low. The equity in her business is five times more than her loans. 

Tamara is looking for a loan to purchase calves and seeds. She expects this investment to increase her income by twenty-five percent. She will save for her children’s education and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves and seeds.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба жительница города Худжанд. Она замужем. Ей 28 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее муж мастер, он занимается починкой бытовой техники. Матлюба работает вместе с мужем. Она помогает ему. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых инструментов инструментов и материалов.
texts.en: Matluba lives in the city of Khujand. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a repairman, specializing in household appliances. Matluba works with her husband and helps him with his work. She is taking this loan to purchase necessary tools and materials.

loans.use: to purchase tools and parts

loans.name: Abasolo San Juan Jicayan Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama  Abasolo San Juan Jicayan  esta conformado por  catorce personas indígenas originarias de un pueblo llamado  san Juanito  donde la mayoría de las  mujeres visten  con nagua y  los pechos no se los cubren.
A lo que la mayoría de los ciudadanos es dedican  es a bordar  y a la venta de gallinas y siembra de maíz.
Una de las integrantes de el grupo es  la señora Edna  una persona  trabajadora humilde e indígena  de cuarenta  y siete años de edad.
Ella se dedica  a la siembra de maíz  veinte años y ala venta de gallinas  desde hace tres años.
Nos dice que lo que mas le gusta  de la venta de gallinas es  criarlas  ya que le gusta mucho el levantarse contenta y tirarles un poco de maíz para alimentarlas y cuando va a poner su nixtamal para  la elaboración de tortillas le da  un poco para   coman y un poco de agua en una bandeja.
Doña Edna esta felizmente casada con el señor Julio de cuarenta y siete años de edad con quien tiene cuadro  hijos Lizbeth, Edna Melisa, Sandra Liliana y Jonatan.
Sus hijos nos comentan que están muy orgullosos de su mama ya que es una señora trabajadora y humilde orgullosa de sus raíces.
Doña Edna  pidió el préstamo para la compra  de más alimento para la crianza de gallinas y más maíz para la siembra.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por  ayudar a las localidades maquinadas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Valencia –quien se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Lucia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Gabriela –quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Hilaria-quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Angélica Maria -quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Alicia-quien se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Francisca- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Aurelia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Anatalia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Inés-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Angelina-quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Maribel-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Santiago-quien se dedica a la venta de manualidades.


Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente indígena y humilde con deseos de superarse.
* las tres señoras de atras la de vestido cafe y blusa blanca  no estan el en grupo cancelaron su credito.
texts.en:
This group is called Abasolo San Juan Jicayan; it is made up of fourteen indigenous people from a town called San Juanito where the majority of the women dress in petticoats and their breasts are uncovered.

Most of the people make embroideries, sell chickens and have corn crops.

One of the members of the group is Mrs. Edna; she is a hardworking and indigenous forty-seven year old woman.

She has harvested corn for over twenty years and has sold chickens for three.

She says that what she enjoys most about selling chickens is caring for them since she likes waking up early to happily feed them corn and sometimes gets the nixtamal (corn flour mix) to make tortillas and gives them a little in a tray with water for them to eat.

Mrs. Edna is happily married to Mr. Julio who is forty-seven years old; they have four children named Lizbeth, Edna Melisa, Sandra Liliana and Jonatan.

Her children say they are very proud of their mother since she is a hardworking woman as well as humble and proud of her roots.

Mrs. Edna needs the loan to buy more feed to care for her chickens and corn for her crop.

She is thankful to the foundation for helping the community.

The other members of the group are: Valencia –sells embroideries. Lucia--sells Mexican treats. Gabriela –sells bread. Hilaria--sells refreshments. Angélica Maria –sells shoes. Alicia--sells embroideries. Francisca-- sells embroideries. Aurelia-- sells Mexican treats. Anatalia-- sells Mexican treats. Inés-- sells Mexican treats. Angelina--sells shoes. Maribel--sells chickens. Santiago--sells crafts.

They are grateful to the foundation for helping indigenous and humble people who wish to improve their lives.

* the three ladies in the back, one with the brown dress and white shirt are not in the group, they cancelled their loan.

loans.use: buy more feed to care for the chickens and corn for her crop.

loans.name: Mayranush Aslanyan

texts.en:
Mayranush is from the village of Mayisyan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with three children: a twenty-four-year-old daughter and two sons (aged twenty-two and twenty-six). Mayranush has a high school education and has been farming for the past twenty-eight years. She also helps her parents with produce grown on the family farm. She dreams of all her children being happily married and is looking forward to being a grandmother. 

Mayranush would like a loan to purchase livestock and feed. She expects this investment to increase her income by thirty percent. She is pleased with microfinance services and the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель Яванского района. Он женат. Ему 32 года. У него двое детей. Алишер имеет высшее образование. Он по профессии фармацевт. Алишер год как открыл аптеку. Он берет кредит для приобретения лекарств.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the Yavan region. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Alisher has university education and is a pharmacist by training. It's been a year since he opened his pharmacy. He is taking this loan to purchase medications.

loans.use: to purchase medicine

loans.name: Mamasharif

texts.ru: Мамашириф житель района Шахритус. Он женат. Ему 51 год. У него пятеро детей. Его дети уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сам он занимается изготовлением кондитерских изделий. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Mamasharif lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His children have left to find work in Russia. Mamasharif makes pastries. He has been engaged in this for three years. He is taking this loan to stock up on ingredients in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Elsi Antonia

texts.es:
Elsi, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes estudian, ella tiene 5 años en el negocio de pupusas, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, atiende con la ayuda de una hermana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprarse materiales para la venta como maíz, aceite, gas propano, quesillo, chicharrón, chocolate y gaseosas, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener el negocio bien surtido, y poder con facilidad preparar la venta.
La aspiración de Elsi es fortalecer el negocio, aumentar las ventas para estabilizar y mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Elsi sells pupusas (a typical Salvadoran dish made with a thick corn tortilla that is filled with fried crackling, cheese or beans), she is 48 years old, lives with her husband and two children who are in school. She has worked selling pupusas for 5 years and works everyday during the evenings with the help of her sister.

She needs a loan to buy materials like corn, oil, propane gas, cheese, fried crackling, chocolate and refreshments. This investment will help her keep her business well stocked and help her make her prepare the food readily.

Elsi’s wish is to strengthen her business and to increase her sales to strengthen and improve her family’s finances.

loans.use: buy materials like corn, oil, propane gas, cheese, fried crackling, chocolate and refreshments.

loans.name: El Ocotal Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama “El Ocotal” ellos pertenecen a la comunidad de San Pedro el Alto ubicada en el municipio de San Felipe del Progreso, los integrantes de este grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que a un costado de donde ellos viven están los árboles que se conocen con el nombre de Ocotal y de los cuales ellos obtienen leña, este grupo lo conforman 5 hombres y 2 mujeres muy amables y serviciales, son muy sociables, bromistas y muy accesibles pero sobre todo muy responsables, en esta comunidad una de las principales actividades que se llevan a cabo es la hortaliza. Los nombres de las integrantes y sus respectivas actividades son las siguientes: 
1.- Alfredo G. (COMPRA DE VASOS DE LICUADORA PARA VENDER) 
2.- Abel E. (COMPRA DE FIGURAS DE RECINA PARA VENDER) 
3.- Ernestina M. (COMPRA DE 4 CERDITOS Y ALIMENTO PARA CRIARLOS PARA VENDER) 
4.- Valentín G. (COMPRA DE DULCES, PISTACHE, CACAHUATES, GARBANZOS PARA VENDER) 
5.- Felipe G. (COMPRA DE 50 POLLOS, ALIMENTO Y MAIZ MOLIDO PARA CRIARLOS Y VENDERLOS) 
6.- Isabel R. (COMPRA DE REFRESCOS, SOPAS, HUEVO, AZUCAR PARA VENDER) 
7.- Lucio G. (COMPRA DE 2 BORREGOS Y PASTURA PARA CRIARLOS Y VENDERLOS) 
Don Alfredo es un hombre de 39 años de edad que está casado con la señora  María del Carmen con la cual tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales actualmente sólo 3 de ellos dependen aún de él. Don Alfredo solicita este crédito ya que él se dedica al comercio de plásticos, en específico a la venta de vasos para licuadora en el cual tiene 6 años de experiencia, cada 8 o 15 días que necesita mercancía él va a una comunidad muy cerca de su pueblo llamada San Agustín Mextepec donde se surte de lo necesario, él va casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos y en ocasiones los vende en el tianguis, él decidió emprender este negocio ya que el trabajaba en la ciudad de México y se terminó el trabajo y quedó desempleado y él necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia, “El único problema casi siempre es la falta de dinero” comenta don Alfredo, dice que también se dedica a la siembra en hortaliza y lo que más siembra es silantro, rabano, coliflor, brocolí, el señor Alfredo es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que necesita un impulso económico, un préstamo de KIVA sin duda le ayudaría mucho.
texts.en:
The following group is called “El Ocotal”, they are from the community of San Pedro el Alto, which is located in the municipality of San Felipe del Progreso.   The members of this group decided to take this name as there are trees near where they live that go by the name of ocotal, from which they obtain firewood.  This group is made up of five men and two women, who are very friendly and helpful.  They are very sociable, like to joke around, and are very accessible to each other, but above all they are very responsible.  One of the main activities that takes place in this community is growing vegetables.

The names of the members and their respective activities are as follow: 
1.- Alfredo G. (will purchase blender cups for sale)
2.- Abel E. (will purchase resin figures for sale) 
3.- Ernestina M. (will purchase four piglets and food in order to raise them for sale) 
4.- Valentín G. (will purchase sweets, pistachios, peanuts and chickpeas for sale) 
5.- Felipe G. (will purchase 50 chickens, feed and milled corn in order to raise them and sell them)
6.- Isabel R. (will purchase sodas, soup, eggs, and sugar for sale) 
7.- Lucio G. (will purchase two sheep and grass in order to raise them and sell them)
 
Don Alfredo is a 39-year-old man, who is married to Señora María del Carmen.  They have seven children together, of whom only three currently are still financially dependent on him. 

Don Alfredo is requesting this loan as he works selling plastics in particular selling cups to use with blenders.  He has six years of experience in this.  Every week or two when he needs merchandise, he goes to a community very near to his village which is called San Agustín Mextepec.  Here he stocks up on everything he needs.  He goes door-to-door selling his products, and on occasion, he sells in the market.  He decided to start up this business as he was working in Mexico City, and when his job terminated he found himself unemployed and needed to support his family.

"The only problem, as always, is the lack of money", comments Don Alfredo.  He says that he also works growing vegetables, mainly cilantro, radishes, cauliflower and broccoli.  

Señor Alfredo is a very hard-working and responsible man who needs a financial boost.  A loan from Kiva will without doubt help him greatly.

loans.use: to purchase cups for using with blenders to sell.

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en:
Nandintsetseg, 19, works as a decorator in a private building company. She loves her job and has been working for over three years. She is unmarried and lives with her grandmother and sister in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, which is in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Nandintsetseg always wants to improve her living conditions as she can. This time she needs a loan to purchase some building materials for her own home renovation job. She is planning to change her ger’s design and renovate some of its old and bad parts. It needs a new a frame for the ger, a new cover, and some other new parts. 

Changing its cover with a new one will reduce the unhealthy coal usage in winter time because the new and warm ger cover won’t have a heat loss in the cold seasons. The coal usage always creates too much air pollution with toxic chemical substances around the cities. It is the worst influence for the environment and everyone’s health. The loan Nandintsetseg is taking will be dedicated to renovate her home with a more natural-oriented idea.

loans.use: to renovate her home with a more natural-oriented idea.

loans.name: Bold-Erdene Galsan

texts.en:
Mr. Bold-Erdene, who is 36, has a taxi business but his earnings don’t usually cover his family's necessities. He lives with his wife and parent in an old house in the suburban area of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.

Bold-Erdene has been running a taxi service since 2004, but he still has not earned enough money for his life. Therefore he is planning to have a second family business such as a grocery store in his back yard. Although he thinks that it will be hard in the starting time, it will notably increase his family's income after it becomes stable and successful.

Now he needs to purchase the commodities from big food markets to build stock for his business. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the food products and beverages to start his grocery store business.

loans.use: To purchase food products and beverages for starting his grocery store business.

loans.name: Nver Muradyan

texts.en:
Nver is from the village of Basen in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is married with two children: a twelve-year-old daughter and a thirteen-year-old son. Nver is in the process of constructing a new family home by using his savings and income from the family farm. Nver and his wife have been farming for the past fifteen years. 

He is looking for a loan to purchase calves. Nver expects this investment to increase the family's income by twenty percent. He is pleased with microfinance services, especially that loan payments are collected in his village.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж электрик. Сама Мунира занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Munira lives in the city of Khujand. She is 23 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is an electrician, while Munira keeps livestock. She raises smaller animals, like sheep and goats, at home. She is taking this loan to purchase more animals for her herd.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал проживает в городе Чкаловск. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Он уже два года как  предоставляет услугу. Акмал занимается ремонтом автомашин. Он работает в автосервисе. Кредит берет для приобретения материалов и инструментов.
texts.en: Akmal lives in the city of Chkalovsk. He is 25 year old, married, and has one child. For two years now, Akmal has been working as a car mechanic at an automotive service centre. He is taking this loan to purchase tools and materials.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools

loans.name: Mercedes Romero Estrada

texts.es: Mercedes de 43 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 24 años, en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio que inició para apoyar los gastos del hogar; ella empezó con un pequeño capital vendiendo productos lácteos en una carretera y por todas las calles del barrio, pues como emigró del Carmen de Bolívar, su pueblo natal,  desde allí trajo sus primeros productos. Hoy continúa pero ha agregado unos nuevos como  ñame, plátano, carne de cerdo etc; Mercedes viaja 2 veces por semana y los distribuye entre los clientes que diariamente consigue y muchos fijos a quienes tiene como sus compradores usuales.  Su meta mas adelante es tener su casa propia, pero para hacerlo requiere más ingresos,  por eso su mayor desafío es contar con un capital de trabajo que no responde a sus expectativas de crecimiento y a las necesidades de su mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara queso, abarrotes, derivados lácteos y también traerá carne para venderá, porque es un producto de muy buena salida. Su éxito radica en que responderá a su clientela y aumentará la posibilidad de vender en mayor volumen y ganar cada vez un poco mas.
texts.en: Mercedes is 43 years old; she lives with her partner and 3 children between the ages of 18 and 24 years of age. They live in the municipality of Soledad some 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. She started her business to help meet the household expenses. She started a business selling dairy products by the road and in streets in her neighborhood. She later she went to Carmen de Bolívar, her native land, and bought her first products. At present, she has added new foodstuffs like ñame (a type of yam), plantains, pork meat, etc. Mercedes travels 2 times a week to buy her products and sells her items daily as she has a steady customer base. Mercedes’ goal is to have her own home but to do it she needs more income that is why her greatest obstacle is to have enough work capital that will match her expectations for growth and the needs of her grocery store. She needs a credikiva, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cheese, groceries, dairy products as well as meat since it is widely sold. Her success is due to her meeting her customers’ demands and this will increase her possibilities to sell in greater quantities and earn more profits little by little.

loans.use: buy cheese, groceries, dairy products as well as meat.

loans.name: Floripe

texts.en:
This is Floripe, 38, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Lito, an employee, and a father to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Floripe maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Floripe's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Floripe dreams of expanding her business and helping her children finish their studies through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 to 27 years. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. Jane operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy urban shopping center and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat for selling. Jane's dream and business goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat for selling.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 32, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Samuel, an overseas contract worker, and a father to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maricel maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Maricel also sells cellphone loads for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maricel hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Aram Hovsepyan

texts.en:
Aram is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region. Arevshat means “lots of sun”. He is married with two sons, aged fifteen and eighteen. Aram has a high school education and has been farming for the past twenty-five years. He also supports his relatives with produce grown on the family farm. 

He would like a loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel. Aram expects this investment to increase his family's income by twenty-two percent. He is careful to keep his debt low, and the equity in his business is six times more than his loans. Aram is pleased with the services of microfinance and the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Eveline Flaure

texts.fr:
Eveline est une jeune femme âgée de 31 ans, célibataire sans enfant,elle vit et exerce son activité à savoir un centre d'appel téléphonique et de transfert de crédit au domicile familial. Actuellement, elle vend en détail et sa marge bénéficiaire n'est pas élévée donc avec ce crédit elle pourra vendre non seulement en détail, amis aussi en gros qui génère plus de revenus et aussi augmenter le stock de marchandises pour son petit commerce annexe à savoir: la vente des sucreries et friandises.

Le Benefice qu'elle aura de ce crédit, lui permettre d'augmenter à nouveau son fonds de commerce et de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Eveline is a young woman of 31 years. She is single and without children. She lives and operates her business, namely a call center and the sale of telephone cards, at home.

Currently she sells retail and her profit margin is not high. With this loan she will be able to sell retail but also wholesale which generates more income. She will also be able to increase her stock of goods for her secondary business, namely, the sale of sweets and candies.

The profit she will make from this loan will enable her to increase her working capital again and provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: to become a wholesaler in the sale of prepaid telephone cards.

loans.name: 23 Sur La Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la 23 sur  la Guadalupe esta integrado  por diez  mujeres trabajadoras  con diferentes   actividades comerciales.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias  de pinotepa  nacional Oaxaca  tierra de gente indígena y  trabajadora.
Donde la gente viste de nagua y  mandil y la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la venta de tamales, tortillas echas a mano y comida como son los ricos caldo de pollo y pescado.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señora Maribel de veinte siete años de edad, se caracteriza por ser  una señora alegre trabajadora  que se dedica  a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como es: tacos dorados, enchiladas, tostadas  de tinja y empanadas de pollo.
Ella nos cuenta  que desde hace cuatro  meses  se ha dedicado a la  venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Es madre soltera tiene dos hijos Yael Uriel de tres años de edad y Gabriela de un año ellos son el motivo  por el cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio y también gracias a la confianza de su mama Alberta una señora trabajadora.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra  de más ingredientes para la elaboración  de antojitos mexicanos como son: chile verdee chile seco, cebolla, ajo, jitomate, queso, aceite y pollo.
Esta muy contenta por el apoyo que le ha dado fundacion para  que pueda darle una mejor vida   a sus hijos Yael  Uriel y Gabriela  que son su razón de vivir.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Alberta-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ofelia-que se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Carina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Arely quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Adelfa-quien se dedica a la venta de tacos blanditos.
Ausencia –quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Mariza-quien se dedica a la venta de pescado
Maria-quien se dedica   ala venta de ropa.
Antolina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Le da las gracias fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado a todas las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called the 23 South la Guadalupe; it is made up of ten hardworking women with different types of jobs.

The members of this group are originally from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, a place made up of indigenous hardworking people.

The majority of the inhabitants dress in petticoats and mandils (a type of apron), most of them work making tamales, handmade tortillas and food like the delicious chicken and fish soup.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Maribel who is twenty-seven years old, she is well-known for being a happy and hardworking woman who sells Mexican treats like: fried tacos, enchiladas (filled rolled tortillas covered with sauce), tostadas de tinja (spicy stewed chicken tostadas) and chicken empanadas (chicken stuffed pastries).

She tells us that she has sold Mexican treats for some four months.

Mrs. Maribel is a single mother; she has two children, Yael Uriel who is three years old and Gabriela who is a year old. They are the reason why she decided to start her business along with her mother’s support, Alberta, who is a hardworking woman.

She needs the loan to buy more ingredients like: dried green chili, onions, garlic, jitomate (a type of tomato), cheese, oil and chicken.

She is very grateful for the support given to her by the foundation so that she is able to give her children, Yael Uriel and Gabriela, a better quality of life since they are her reason for being.

The other members of the group are: Alberta—sells Mexican treats. Ofelia—sells clothing. Carina—sells clothing. Arely—sells refreshments. Adelfa—sells soft tacos. Ausencia –-sells clothing. Mariza—sells fish. Maria—sells clothing. Antolina—sells clothing.

They are grateful to the foundation for the support they give to all hardworking women.

loans.use: buy dried green chili, onions, garlic, jitomate (a type of tomato), cheese, oil and chicken.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 62-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 22 to 37 years. He describes himself to be an aggressive man. Peter operates a retail store where he sells men's suits. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located along a busy street and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of men's suits. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy one bale of men's suits. His business goal is to run another clothes retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy one bale of men's suits.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 7 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. Caroline has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Vahram Aboyan

texts.en:
Vahram is from the village of Basen in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is happily married with three children: two daughters (aged twenty-seven and twenty) and a sixteen-year-old son. Vahram has a high school education and has been farming for the past twenty years. He also helps his daughter’s family with produce grown on the family farm.
